=== [[Talk:List of states and union territories of India by fertility rate#rfc_9D51445|Talk:List of states and union territories of India by fertility rate]] expired 2020-07-14 05:01 ===
* Id: 9D51445
* Date: 2020-06-24 22:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|964341216|STYLE 964341216}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|967592752|STYLE 967592752}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Change decreasePositive/decreaseNegative/increasePositive/increaseNegative template to decreaseNeutral template as seen here https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_states_and_union_territories_of_India_by_fertility_rate&oldid=962920259 . 22:56, 24 June 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:People's Mujahedin of Iran#rfc_EE6DF8B|Talk:People's Mujahedin of Iran]] expired 2020-07-14 10:01 ===
* Id: EE6DF8B
* User: Stefka Bulgaria
* Date: 2020-06-14 09:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|962485152|HIST 962485152}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|962485162|POL 962485162}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|962485168|RELI 962485168}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|962485173|SOC 962485173}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|967623915|HIST 967623915}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|967623922|POL 967623922}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|967623924|RELI 967623924}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|967623927|SOC 967623927}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Shall we summarize the following:

{{tq|According to a BBC article, the US government described the MEK as a "Cult", with one US colonel saying "the organisation was a cult", and yet another retired US general saying "Cult? How about admirably focused group?". United States Department of State describes MEK in a 2008 report as "cult-like terrorist organisation". Iraq's ambassador to the U.S., Samir Sumaidaie, said in 2011 that the MEK was "nothing more than a cult". Some academics, including Ervand Abrahamian, Stephanie Cronin, Wilfried Buchta, Eli Clifton and others have also made similar claims. Former French Foreign Ministry spokesman Romain Nadal criticized the MEK for having a "cult nature"; while Former French Foreign Minister Bernard Kouchner said that he was "ashamed" by this statement.|}}

{{tq|A report commissioned by the US government, based on interviews within Camp Ashraf, concluded that the MEK had "many of the typical characteristics of a cult, such as authoritarian control, confiscation of assets, sexual control (including mandatory divorce and celibacy), emotional isolation, forced labour, sleep deprivation, physical abuse and limited exit options". In 2003 Elizabeth Rubin referred to the MEK as "Cult of Rajavi".|}} [[User:Stefka Bulgaria|Stefka Bulgaria]] ([[User talk:Stefka Bulgaria|talk]]) 09:40, 14 June 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Spencer Wells#rfc_81FA531|Talk:Spencer Wells]] expired 2020-07-14 11:01 ===
* Id: 81FA531
* User: Joshgladwin
* Date: 2020-07-14 01:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|967573206|BIO 967573206}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|967631016|BIO 967631016}}
* RFC Text:

This request for comment has been started about the verifiability of this [https://www.israellycool.com/2020/06/29/spencer-wells-adjunct-professor-at-university-of-texas-austin-says-israelis-deserve-to-die page] by the Israellycool blog as it applies to a series of alleged Twitter posts by Mr Wells, which have since been deleted.
This RfC asks:
1) Can the above source be relied upon solely for the purpose of alleging that the tweets were made? You'll note the blog posts contain screen shots of the alleged tweets.
2) Had the offending tweets not been deleted, could they be relied on as a source given Mr Well's twitter account is "verified"?
3) If the answer to either of the above is "no", what is preventing Mr Well's from continuing to make inflammatory tweets and delete them, without any being able to attract criticism on Wikipedia?
[[User:Joshgladwin|Joshgladwin]] ([[User talk:Joshgladwin|talk]]) 01:39, 14 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of epidemics#rfc_013544D|Talk:List of epidemics]] expired 2020-07-14 11:01 ===
* Id: 013544D
* Date: 2020-06-14 10:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|962491926|LANG 962491926}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|967631019|LANG 967631019}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|967631020|SCI 967631020}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Regarding these edits:[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_epidemics&diff=962039016&oldid=962029939][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_epidemics&diff=962136928&oldid=962039016&diffmode=source][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_epidemics&diff=962163003&oldid=962136928&diffmode=source][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_epidemics&diff=962166340&oldid=962163003&diffmode=source] Should the 2013-19 influenza be titled:
# 2013‚Äì19 [[Avian influenza]] epidemic
# 2013‚Äì19 China influenza epidemic
# 2013‚Äì19 China [[avian influenza]] epidemic
# Something else (please state what)

If #2, then should the term "avian influenza" be mentioned elsewhere (eg. the "disease" column [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_epidemics&diff=962187193&oldid=962166340&diffmode=source])? 10:58, 14 June 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_7AF6928|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2020-07-14 11:01 ===
* Id: 7AF6928
* User: U1Quattro
* Date: 2020-07-13 03:24:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|967417912|PROP 967417912}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|967631023|PROP 967631023}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This request for comment has been started about the verifiability of a Bring a Trailer and whether or not it can be used as a source on Wikipedia.

This RfC asks:

1. Should a buying selling website with user generated content be used as a source for the verifiability of content added?

2. If the answer to the above is yes, then which Wikipedia policy merits its inclusion as a reliable source?

3. How often can we trust a content of a site like this with no editorial control where a user can write whatever they want while placing an item for sale?

Comments in this regard will be highly appreciated.[[User:U1Quattro|<span style="color:darkgreen;font-family:Verdana;text-shadow:2px 2px 2px #a6a6a6">U<sup>1</sup> <sub>q</sub>uattro</span>]]&nbsp;[[User talk:U1Quattro|<span style="color:green;text-shadow:2px 2px 2px #"><small>''TALK''</small></span>]] 03:24, 13 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:University of California, Berkeley#rfc_19D05A5|Talk:University of California, Berkeley]] expired 2020-07-15 12:01 ===
* Id: 19D05A5
* User: Aapjes#top
* Date: 2020-07-09 14:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|966847124|SCI 966847124}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|967803465|SCI 967803465}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 I would like third-party feedback on the following questions:
* When an institution or other thing is named after a person, should this person be brought up in a way that focuses on naming-specific issues (why was the thing named after this person and what (potential) controversies are there around this naming)? Or should the mention focus on what makes the person notable in general? Or a bit of both?
* Is the fact that Berkeley is named after a slave owner only [[WP:DUE|appropriate to include]] when there is a (sufficiently non-fringe) active activist effort to specifically rename UC Berkeley? Or do the many attempts to destroy the statues of slave owners and to rename institutions, buildings and such that are named after slave owners, open racists and such, indicate that there is a general interest in knowing whether something is named after a person who was a slave owner?

Note that there seems to be no disagreement that Berkeley was a slave owner, so I see no need for people to provide feedback on that issue. [[User:Aapjes|Aapjes]] ([[User talk:Aapjes#top|talk]] 14:25, 9 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Edward Colston#rfc_9E20935|Talk:Edward Colston]] expired 2020-07-15 19:01 ===
* Id: 9E20935
* User: Ghmyrtle
* Date: 2020-06-16 12:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|962868427|BIO 962868427}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|962868436|HIST 962868436}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|962909815|BIO 962909815}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|967858115|HIST 967858115}}
* RFC Text:

The opening paragraph currently reads:  <blockquote>'''Edward Colston''' (2 November 1636 ‚Äì 11 October 1721) was an English merchant, philanthropist, and [[Tories (British political party)|Tory]] Member of Parliament who was involved in the [[Atlantic slave trade]]. In the 19th century he was promoted as a local benefactor in his native city of [[Bristol]] in part due to having donated money to charities which supported people aligned with his political and religious views.</blockquote>  Should this wording be amended so as to avoid describing him as a "philanthropist"?  It is universally accepted that he had close links to the slave trade, but he has been described as a philanthropist in reliable sources, and was a financial benefactor to charities during his lifetime.   [[User:Ghmyrtle|Ghmyrtle]] ([[User talk:Ghmyrtle|talk]]) 12:18, 16 June 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Taiwan#rfc_E5B1ED7|Talk:Taiwan]] expired 2020-07-16 06:01 ===
* Id: E5B1ED7
* User: Visaliaw
* Date: 2020-06-16 05:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|962818528|POL 962818528}}

The Taiwanese government website says '''Republic of China (Taiwan)''' is its official name. [https://www.taiwan.gov.tw/about.php] News articles describe '''Republic of China''' as official name. === [[Talk:Bengal tiger#rfc_D0695AB|Talk:Bengal tiger]] expired 2020-07-16 14:01 ===
* Id: D0695AB
* User: AnomalousAtom
* Date: 2020-06-16 13:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|962876690|SCI 962876690}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the first sentence of [[Bengal tiger]] (and similar for [[Siberian tiger]], [[Caspian tiger]], [[South China tiger]], [[Indochinese tiger]], and [[Malayan tiger]]) say:
#The '''Bengal tiger''' (''[[Panthera tigris tigris]]'') is a [[tiger]] population native to the [[Indian subcontinent]].
#The '''Bengal tiger''' is a [[tiger]] from a specific population of the ''[[Panthera tigris tigris]]'' subspecies that is native to the [[Indian subcontinent]].
#'''Bengal tigers''' form a regional subpopulation of the ''[[Panthera tigris tigris]]'' subspecies of [[tiger]]s that is native to the [[Indian subcontinent]].
#'''Bengal tigers''' form a regional subpopulation of the ''[[Panthera tigris tigris]]'' subspecies that is native to the [[Indian subcontinent]].

How should popes, cardinals, and bishops be referred to in running text? Is "Pope" or "Cardinal" or "Bishop" more akin to a [[MOS:JOBTITLES|job title]] or an [[MOS:HON|honorific]]? === [[Talk:Grover Furr#rfc_55D2818|Talk:Grover Furr]] expired 2020-07-16 18:01 ===
* Id: 55D2818
* User: Ismail
* Date: 2020-06-16 17:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|962909815|BIO 962909815}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|968014662|BIO 968014662}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
For multiple years now there's been a dispute between myself and others over the size of the article's bibliography. While the arguments can be read above, my argument boils down to believing [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Grover_Furr&diff=960939169&oldid=960644832#Bibliography my proposed bibliography] is not inordinately long nor against Wikipedia's rules. I think if size is an issue (in terms of the article's height), the bibliography could either be formatted differently or there could be an option to "hide" some or all of the bibliography unless a user clicks on a button to reveal the full contents. --[[User:Ismail|Ismail]] ([[User talk:Ismail|talk]]) 17:42, 16 June 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Shaherose Charania#rfc_1BC8475|Talk:Shaherose Charania]] expired 2020-07-16 19:01 ===

There's very little in this [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Conflict_of_interest/Noticeboard&oldid=967892096#wikiprofessionals_inc written-for-payment] article that's not relevant to [[Women 2.0]] or its offshoot, and there are almost no incoming links. I therefore propose to convert this article into a redirect to [[Women 2.0]].

=== [[Talk:Arab Christians#rfc_197268E|Talk:Arab Christians]] expired 2020-07-16 23:01 ===

=== [[Talk:Ruth Ellis#rfc_F2333DD|Talk:Ruth Ellis]] expired 2020-07-17 04:01 ===
* Id: F2333DD
* User: Helper201
* Date: 2020-06-17 03:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|962987065|BIO 962987065}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|968083034|BIO 968083034}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Asking to be able to include the United Kingdom as part of the person's birth place and death place in the infobox, for the following reasons. Firstly, the person is specifically defined as British in both the infobox and the main text. The corresponding sovereign state to British nationality is the UK. Secondly, under [[Template:Infobox person]], for birth place and death place it is stated we include under each "city, administrative region, sovereign state." The sovereign state in this instance is the United Kingdom (not England or Wales). Thirdly the prominence of this article is largely due to the person being known for being the last woman executed in the UK. Therefore contextually the article has far more relevance to the UK as a whole than England or Wales (the law being applied was UK law also, not relevant to specifically England or Wales). Adding the UK only helps greater inform global [[Wikipedia:Reader|readers]] of the article with little or no knowledge of the subject. See [[WP:DRDR]] and [[WP:RF]]. Providing more correct factual information that also adds as clarification only aids the informativeness of the page, it does not take it away. This should take president over grips around looks or how an article lines up with others. [[User:Helper201|Helper201]] ([[User talk:Helper201|talk]]) 03:52, 17 June 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Proposed deletion#rfc_BD2317C|Wikipedia talk:Proposed deletion]] expired 2020-07-17 12:01 ===
* Id: BD2317C
* User: Aymatth2
* Date: 2020-07-10 01:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|966926741|POLICY 966926741}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|968128524|POLICY 968128524}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Non-confirmed editors, or IPs, will often be unfamiliar with Wikipedia's policies and conventions, and may not understand when removing a PROD is appropriate. This is to propose that removal of a PROD by a non-confirmed user should not be allowed. [[User:Aymatth2|Aymatth2]] ([[User talk:Aymatth2|talk]]) 01:18, 10 July 2020 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia talk:Proposed deletion#rfc_D5A48E3|Wikipedia talk:Proposed deletion]] expired 2020-07-17 12:01 ===
* Id: D5A48E3
* User: Aymatth2
* Date: 2020-07-05 00:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|966744275|POLICY 966744275}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|968128524|POLICY 968128524}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Articles should automatically be rejected from PROD if they are older than 5 years or have been edited by more than 10 editors, since any article which has survived inspection for such a long period or by so many editors should never be PRODed. [[User:Aymatth2|Aymatth2]] ([[User talk:Aymatth2|talk]]) 00:30, 5 July 2020 (UTC)}}

In [[J. K. Rowling#Transgender issues]] and [[Politics of J. K. Rowling#Transgender issues]]:

1. When discussing Rowling's response to criticism of her views on transgender issues, cited to [https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-rowling/j-k-rowling-reveals-past-abuse-and-defends-right-to-speak-on-trans-issues-idUSKBN23H2XI this] source from [[Reuters]], should her views be relayed as '''A''' {{tq|She said that she was a survivor of [[domestic violence|domestic abuse]] and [[sexual assault]], and stated that "When you throw open the doors of bathrooms and changing rooms to any man who believes or feels he‚Äôs a woman ... then you open the door to any and all men who wish to come inside", while stating that most trans people were vulnerable and deserved protection.}} or '''B''' {{tq|She said that she was a survivor of [[domestic violence|domestic abuse]] and [[sexual assault]], and stated that allowing trans women access to single-sex spaces was a danger to women, while stating that most trans people were vulnerable and deserved protection.}}?

2. Should the section state, {{tq|Transgender pop singer [[Dana International]] spoke in support of Rowling.}}, sourced to [https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-rowling/j-k-rowling-reveals-past-abuse-and-defends-right-to-speak-on-trans-issues-idUSKBN23H2XI Reuters] and [https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/.premium-transgender-superstar-dana-international-to-the-defense-of-j-k-rowling-1.8919710 Haaretz]? <span style="font-family:Palatino">[[User:Crossroads|'''Crossroads''']]</span> <sup>[[User talk:Crossroads|-talk-]]</sup> 21:16, 17 June 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Tucker Carlson#rfc_A27EBFF|Talk:Tucker Carlson]] expired 2020-07-18 15:01 ===
* Id: A27EBFF
* User: Slatersteven
* Date: 2020-07-18 12:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|968290113|BIO 968290113}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|968290119|POL 968290119}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|968297193|SCI 968297193}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|968304787|BIO 968304787}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|968304791|SCI 968304791}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|968304796|POL 968304796}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A. Is it undue to mention Carlson's recent comments about face masks.

B. If yes, Should we say "In July 2020, Carlson criticized public health efforts to halt the spread of the coronavirus. Carlson falsely claimed "Many schools that do plan to reopen will do so under a series of restrictions that have no basis of any kind in science" leading to claims he had said there is no scientific evidence (and contradicting earlier support) for the use of masks and social distancing. "

C.  If yes, Should we say "In July 2020, Carlson was criticised for saying "Many schools that do plan to reopen will do so under a series of restrictions that have no basis of any kind in science" leading to claims he had said there is no scientific evidence (and contradicting earlier support) for the use of masks and social distancing." 

D.  If yes, Should we leave out "leading to claims he had said there is no scientific evidence (and contradicting earlier support) for the use of masks and social distancing.".[[User:Slatersteven|Slatersteven]] ([[User talk:Slatersteven|talk]]) 12:40, 18 July 2020 (UTC)}}

Should the article include https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/resellers/psu-selector.html as Intel requires all the 80 Plus spec., but not only that (see information above), they also add info for tested PSU about ErP when you turn off PC (there are always some parts of cumputer that work even when PC is turned off), they also test Modern Standy (Always On, Always Connected, when PC works like smartphone, it will be used in next notebook bigLittle Intel Cores), also there are some min. requirements for C6-C9 sleep states. That was a problem in the past when PSU were not compatible. We should not only use one source for tests (from 80 Plus itself, it is just wrong as we must not use primary sources). === [[Talk:Chrysler#rfc_47905FF|Talk:Chrysler]] expired 2020-07-20 11:01 ===
* Id: 47905FF
* User: Thunderbolt.wiki
* Date: 2020-07-19 19:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|968566895|ECON 968566895}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|968601595|ECON 968601595}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose that the section ''[[Chrysler#Chrysler brand|Chrysler brand]]'' be split into a separate article called ''[[Chrysler]]'' and the remaining sections of this article be titled '''[[FCA US]]'''. The company that was once know as Chrysler has officially been named FCA US for a number of years now and the Chrysler name merely lives on as a vehicle brand of the parent company. The [[Chrysler#Chrysler brand|Chrysler brand]] section is adequately sized to be its own article. Currently, all of [[Fiat Chrysler Automobiles]]' brands have their own articles except for Chrysler. [[Fiat Chrysler Automobiles]]' other direct subsidiary is [[FCA Italy]] which already has its own article separate from the [[Fiat]] brand, so there is precedent for this split. Chrysler is no longer even [[FCA US]]'s top brand and it is arguably not even a household name anymore. When the merger of [[Fiat Chrysler Automobiles]] and [[Groupe PSA]] is complete, Chrysler won't even be in the name of the parent company anymore as it is being renamed [[Stellantis]]. [[User:Thunderbolt.wiki|Thunderbolt.wiki]] ([[User talk:Thunderbolt.wiki|talk]]) 19:40, 19 July 2020 (UTC)}}

What visual element should be used for the information dissemination section (which consists primarily of the misinformation subsection) for this article?

[[File:President Donald Trump suggests measures to treat COVID-19 during Coronavirus Task Force press briefing.webm|thumb|300px|Option 1]]
*'''Option 1 <s>(status quo)</s>:''' The video (right) of Donald Trump suggesting that disinfectant injections or exposure to ultraviolet light might help treat COVID-19, with the caption (previously [[Talk:COVID-19_pandemic/Archive_36#Misinformation_photo_caption|affirmed as consensus]]) {{tq|U.S. president [[Donald Trump]] suggested at a press briefing on 23{{nbsp}}April that [[disinfectant]] injections or exposure to [[ultraviolet light]] might help treat COVID-19. There is no evidence that either could be a viable method.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Rogers|first=Katie|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/24/us/politics/trump-inject-disinfectant-bleach-coronavirus.html|title=Trump's Suggestion That Disinfectants Could Be Used to Treat Coronavirus Prompts Aggressive Pushback|date=24 April 2020|work=The New York Times|access-date=25 April 2020|last2=Hauser|first2=Christine|issn=0362-4331|last3=Yuhas|first3=Alan|last4=Haberman|first4=Maggie}}</ref> <small>(1:05{{nbsp}}min)</small>}}
*'''Option 2:''' Some other photo or video, or combination of photos/videos (previous options discussed [[Talk:COVID-19_pandemic/Archive_33#Misinformation_section_photo/visual|here]] and elsewhere)
*'''Option 3:''' Have no visual element for the section

{{rfcquote|text=
1. Is the ADL a generally reliable source?

2. Is the ADL a reliable source on topics related to hate groups and extremism in the United States?

3. Is the ADL reliable and/or a biased source for Israel/Palestine related topics?

4. Should the labelling of organisations and individuals by the ADL (particularly as antisemitic) be attributed?

The [[Anti-Defamation League]] has been cited around 1,000 times on Wikipedia according to {{duses|adl.org}} [[User:Hemiauchenia|Hemiauchenia]] ([[User talk:Hemiauchenia|talk]]) 13:31, 2 July 2020 (UTC)}}

See above for the full discussion. This was then removed by [[User:Anna Laura Simoni|Anna Laura Simoni]] on [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Devi_Sridhar&diff=966391674&oldid=966210721 6 July] for what I interpreted as a politically motivated reason which (which I don't believe is an acceptable reason to remove a piece that is supported by a [[WP:RS|reliable source]]), I therefore reverted on [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Devi_Sridhar&diff=967229066&oldid=966391674 12 July]. === [[Talk:Julian day#rfc_EF579A0|Talk:Julian day]] expired 2020-07-22 16:01 ===
* Id: EF579A0
* User: Jc3s5h
* Date: 2020-06-22 15:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|963927102|SCI 963927102}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|968966937|SCI 968966937}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Is integer division well defined in mathematics, and in computer programming languages?

Many of the algorithms in the article use the integer division operation (but no use is made of the remainder, which might be thought of in math as one of the results of a division, the other result being the quotient). But [[User:Eric Kvaalen|Eric Kvaalen]] states in the thread [[#Wrong formulas]] ' All I'm saying is that we can rewrite the formulas to use FLOOR instead of so-called "integer division" which is not well defined and not commonly understood.' [[User:Jc3s5h|Jc3s5h]] ([[User talk:Jc3s5h|talk]]) 15:10, 22 June 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Welfare#rfc_938989C|Talk:Welfare]] expired 2020-07-23 18:01 ===
* Id: 938989C
* User: ItsPugle
* Date: 2020-07-07 11:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|966491778|POL 966491778}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|966491791|SOC 966491791}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|969152325|POL 969152325}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|969152329|SOC 969152329}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I'm a bit lost here as to where the articles [[Welfare]] and [[Social security]] differ. The leads of both articles describe their subject as payments to those with little or no income for the purpose of subsidising/paying for/assisting with basic human needs. Even in this article, the terms "welfare" and "social security" are thrown around as synonyms for each other. When you strip down the topics to their core subject, surely [[welfare]] and [[social security]] are one and the same? If not, there needs to be serious work done on both, as they are indistinguishable right now. I also think it's worth considering the influence of [[Americentrism|americentric bias]] in these topics; they seem to focus quite heavily on only the US' system of welfare (or lack thereof), and truly, don't fairly or equally explore other countries where welfare is significantly more important. Even the term "social security" points to the United States - In Australia, Canada, New Zealand, and many many many more countries, it's called welfare, Germany and parts of Europe calls it social care, the UK calls it state welfare. You can even see on this Google Trends map that "social security" is almost exclusively American: [https://ibb.co/zSxrBHq https://ibb.co/zSxrBHq]. [[User:ItsPugle|ItsPugle]] ([[User talk:ItsPugle|talk]]) 11:51, 7 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Hanging Gardens of Babylon#rfc_5C2120D|Talk:Hanging Gardens of Babylon]] expired 2020-07-26 23:01 ===
* Id: 5C2120D
* Date: 2020-07-26 21:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|969692861|HIST 969692861}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|969710759|HIST 969710759}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Traditionally, the '''Hanging Gardens''' (the Wonder of the Ancient World) were thought to have been in Babylon.  The current Wikipedia article is entitled '''Hanging Gardens of Babylon'''.  Some very credible academic work has argued that the Hanging Gardens were actually in Nineveh, making both historical-literary and archaelogical arguments.  There are two questions: to what extent is there a 'consensus' view that the Hanging Gardens definitely were in Nineveh as opposed to the idea being just one interesting and compelling hypothesis? And: what is the best title for the page - '''Hanging Gardens of Babylon''', '''Hanging Gardens of Nineveh''' or simply '''Hanging Gardens'''? At the moment, discussion is between a very small number of editors, and it would benefit from wider perspectives. [[User:Parsonscat|The Parson's Cat]] ([[User_talk:Parsonscat|talk]]) 21:38, 26 July 2020 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|969702058|POL 969702058}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
People have given multiple ideas for splitting the article over the years, I would suggest a page for  the post war period (1945 to 1979) and more recent history (1979 to present). Any thoughts? [[User:Llewee|Llewee]] ([[User talk:Llewee|talk]]) 19:22, 26 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Boogaloo movement#rfc_FB8522C|Talk:Boogaloo movement]] expired 2020-07-27 01:01 ===
* Id: FB8522C
* User: GorillaWarfare
* Date: 2020-06-27 00:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|964693645|POL 964693645}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|969718079|POL 969718079}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=

=== [[Talk:Cognitive-Theoretic Model of the Universe#rfc_C8652CA|Talk:Cognitive-Theoretic Model of the Universe]] expired 2020-07-28 02:01 ===
* Id: C8652CA
* User: Scarpy
* Date: 2020-07-08 05:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|966627087|RELI 966627087}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|969903628|RELI 969903628}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In 2006 two articles were written on the Cognitive Theoretic Model of the Universe (CTMU). They didn't pass AfD at the time. One was [[Wikipedia:Articles_for_deletion/Cognitive_Theoretic_Model_of_the_Universe]] (without the hypen) and the other was this one [[Wikipedia:Articles_for_deletion/Cognitive-Theoretic_Model_of_the_Universe]] (with the hypen). The result of the later discussion was a redirect of this page to [[Christopher Langan]], the author of the CTMU.  Since 2006 more as been written about the CTMU and there are now more several secondary sources discussing it. There was a [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cognitive-Theoretic_Model_of_the_Universe&oldid=966538552 "2020 version" of the Cognitive-Theoretic Model of the Universe this article posted this week] in place of this redirect but that has since been replaced with a redirect to [[Christopher Langan]] again. This RfC is to see if there if consensus can be generated on the notability of the CTMU with the [[WP:RS]] published since 2006, and if deemed notability should the redirect be replaced with a new version of the article along the lines of the one posted this week? - [[User:Scarpy|Scarpy]] ([[User talk:Scarpy|talk]]) 05:53, 8 July 2020 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 

I think this is necessary because similarly to other permissions, we do have some non-admins who hold this permission. This is the only permission that administrators can grant themselves that gives them access to more functions. For example, if an admin granted themselves the rollback user right, that would be redundant because rollback is already bundled into the toolset. I think we should make it easy for admins to edit edit filters. [[User:Interstellarity|Interstellarity]] ([[User talk:Interstellarity|talk]]) 20:10, 28 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_B9A8541|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2020-07-29 23:01 ===
* Id: B9A8541
* User: pythoncoder
* Date: 2020-07-27 21:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|969877091|POLICY 969877091}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|970210387|POLICY 970210387}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following sentence be temporarily added to [[Wikipedia:Administrators#Restoration_of_adminship]] (in the "over two years with no edits" bullet)?

:Adminstrators desysopped on or before November 4, 2019 may be resysopped if they have made at least one edit in the last ''three years'' (rather than two years), as long as they file their resysop request before 00:00 UTC on October 1, 2020. This means that admins that meet these criteria and were desysopped for inactivity may be resysopped if they have edited in the past ''two years'' (rather than one year).

In addition, admins that would have been eligible for resysop under the pre-2019 rules should be notified of the 2019 rule change and the existence of this grace period.

This is in response to a question raised at a resysop request on [[WP:BN]]. Hopefully this RfC will clear up confusion on this and any future similar cases. Feel free to suggest wording changes. ‚Äî[[User:pythoncoder|<span style="color:#004080">python</span><span style="color:olive">coder</span>]]&nbsp;([[User talk:pythoncoder|talk]]&nbsp;&#124;&nbsp;[[Special:Contribs/pythoncoder|contribs]]) 21:59, 27 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Political party strength in U.S. states#rfc_9C7C063|Talk:Political party strength in U.S. states]] expired 2020-07-30 21:01 ===
* Id: 9C7C063
* Date: 2020-06-30 20:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|965355157|HIST 965355157}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|965355161|POL 965355161}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|970359543|HIST 970359543}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|970359550|POL 970359550}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is a dispute about whether to include the [[District of Columbia]] and the [[Territories of the United States|U.S. territories]] (in tables) within the [[Political party strength in U.S. states]] article. The five U.S. territories are [[American Samoa]], [[Guam]], the [[Northern Mariana Islands]], [[Puerto Rico]] and the [[U.S. Virgin Islands]]. The proposal to include the District of Columbia and territories would involve moving the article to "Political party strength in the U.S. states and territories" or simply "Political party strength in the United States". The argument in favor of including the District of Columbia and territories in the article is that these political entities are often considered state-equivalents, with state-like characteristics (such as governors and legislatures). The opposing argument is that the District of Columbia and territories are not relevant to the article. 20:22, 30 June 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Proposed deletion#rfc_C882E86|Wikipedia talk:Proposed deletion]] expired 2020-08-01 05:01 ===
* Id: C882E86
* User: Pburka
* Date: 2020-07-04 18:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|966750262|POLICY 966750262}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|970581430|POLICY 970581430}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
PROD assumes some familiarity with Wikipedia's policies and conventions, and users are expected to be able to judge whether or not a deletion would be non-controversial. IP editors and new editors should be limited to AFD, which guarantees some level of review. PROD should be limited to [[WP:CONFIRM|autoconfirmed/confirmed]], or perhaps [[WP:XC|extended confirmed]] editors. (Not sure how this would be enforced, technically.) <small>Proposed by [[User:Pburka|pburka]] ([[User talk:Pburka|talk]]) 18:43, 4 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Categories for discussion#rfc_AD3C666|Wikipedia talk:Categories for discussion]] expired 2020-08-01 10:01 ===
* Id: AD3C666
* User: Fayenatic london
* Date: 2020-07-02 09:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|965607389|STYLE 965607389}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|970608680|STYLE 970608680}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Consistency in category names and the main article is positively helpful in some hierarchies, e.g. music albums, because of the use of {{tl|albums category}} then automatically links to the main article, the head category and the songs category, e.g. [[:Category:1927 (band) albums]]. In that example, we are committed to keeping the disambiguator "(band)" as part of all the related category names. 

However, great minds have told us that
:"A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds" ‚Äì¬†[[Ralph Waldo Emerson]]
:"Consistency is the last refuge of the unimaginative" ‚Äì¬†[[Oscar Wilde]]

In other hierarchies we are rolling out consistency even where there is little apparent gain. For example, [[Terminator (disambiguation)|Terminator]] is a disambiguation page covering e.g. gene terminator as well as the famous film series and its spin-off media, whose main article therefore has to be [[Terminator (franchise)]]. The main category is therefore likewise [[:Category:Terminator (franchise)]]. The debatable point is that [[WP:C2C]] is then invoked to rename all its sub-cats e.g. [[:Category:Terminator films]] to [[:Category:Terminator (franchise) films]]. IMHO this would result in longwinded and clumsy titles for insufficient gain. 

I therefore propose that the disambiguator "(franchise)" should '''generally''' not be replicated into sub-category names for e.g. specific media types within a franchise hierarchy. Only the top category for that franchise needs to contain the word "(franchise)".

Likewise, similar disambiguators may also be excluded from the general requirement for consistency, e.g. the disambiguators "(film series)", "(TV series)" and "(video game series)" probably do not need to be replicated down to categories of characters, episodes etc, except where there is ambiguity at that level. ‚Äì [[User:Fayenatic london|Fayenatic]] [[User talk:Fayenatic london|'''<span style="color:#FF0000;">L</span>'''ondon]] 09:23, 2 July 2020 (UTC)}}

* Date: 2020-07-02 14:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|970642746|POL 970642746}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is a debate about whether [[Juan Guaid√≥]] can be included in the list of the youngest current world leaders or not. [[User: Doomer1557 | <span style = "color: # 000080"> '' 'Doomer1557' '' </span>]] ([[User_talk: Doomer1557 | talk]]) 14:40, 2 July 2020 (UTC)}}

* Id: CAADF28

* User: Hemiauchenia

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|970922500|RELI 970922500}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|970922503|SOC 970922503}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|970922505|PROP 970922505}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which of the following best describes the [[WP:RS|reliability]] of the reporting of the [[Middle East Media Research Institute]] (MEMRI)? MEMRI has been cited around 560 times on Wikipedia per {{duses|memri.org}} and {{duses|memritv.org}}.

*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]] as in the [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 220#Daily Mail RfC|2017 RfC]] of the ''[[Daily Mail]]'' [[User:Hemiauchenia|Hemiauchenia]] ([[User talk:Hemiauchenia|talk]]) 13:06, 4 July 2020 (UTC)}}

* User: Chidgk1
* Date: 2020-07-27 06:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose that if a list exists in a non-English Wikipedia the corresponding English list should be allowed to use Wikidata for its tables. This would have the advantage that the same structured data would not have to be updated in several different places. I would use it on [[List of active coal-fired power stations in Turkey]]. [[User:Chidgk1|Chidgk1]] ([[User talk:Chidgk1|talk]]) 06:10, 27 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Verifiability#rfc_B0DF12D|Wikipedia talk:Verifiability]] expired 2020-08-03 17:01 ===
* Id: B0DF12D
* User: Michaelbluejay
* Date: 2020-07-22 21:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|970977966|POLICY 970977966}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|971006456|POLICY 971006456}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
== RfC: Let's define self-published sources '''

Consensus above (no objections) was that this policy should define SPS (which makes sense, because it's impossible to apply the policy if we don't know what SPS is and what it's not).  So let's hear some suggested definitions, please.  (I'd offer mine, except that I don't have strong feelings about what the definition should be (just that we should have one), and when I copied the one from WP:USINGSPS (publisher=author), it was rejected.)  Please suggest an ''actual definition'', not just a discussion that doesn't include an actual definition.  If no actual definitions are proposed, I intend to try again to insert the "author=publisher" definition from WP:USINGSPS.  About that, Whatamidoing thinks WP:USINGSPS is a good place for acceptable/non-acceptable examples of SPS, so if WP:USINGSPS is trustworthy, then it ought to be trustworthy for the definition.  If it's not trustworthy for the definition, then it's not trustworthy for acceptable/unacceptable examples either, and the acceptable/unacceptable examples should be included in this policy. -[[User:Michaelbluejay|MichaelBluejay]] ([[User talk:Michaelbluejay|talk]]) 21:23, 22 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Politics of Australia#rfc_B78651D|Talk:Politics of Australia]] expired 2020-08-04 15:01 ===
* Id: B78651D
* User: ItsPugle
* Date: 2020-07-05 14:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|966177003|POL 966177003}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|966177007|SOC 966177007}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|971162568|POL 971162568}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|971162575|SOC 971162575}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hi! I'd like to garnish some opinions about exactly what this article is about. The name suggests an exploration of the political landscape of Australia, such as the Labor and Liberal parties, and the power of the crossbench. On the other hand, the current article content explores the system of governance in Australia, with very significant overlaps with [[Australian Government]] in terms of the branches of government. If this article is about politics, then the article probably needs to be rewritten. If this article is about governance, then it needs to be moved to an article title that better reflects this (''{{no redirect|Governance of Australia}}''?), and likely copyedited significantly. [[User:ItsPugle|ItsPugle]] ([[User talk:ItsPugle|talk]]) 14:23, 5 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Queer erasure#rfc_36DD9A4|Talk:Queer erasure]] expired 2020-08-05 06:01 ===
* Id: 36DD9A4
* User: ItsPugle
* Date: 2020-07-06 05:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|966281190|SOC 966281190}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|971290677|SOC 971290677}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hi! I'm a bit concerned about the exact scope of this article. Considering that Wikipedia already has significant articles about [[bisexual erasure]] and [[lesbian erasure]], as well as passive mention of [[asexual erasure]], this article has very little in terms of meaningful content, not to mention that it's a stub at best. In fact, this article, to me, is bordering on being up for [[WP:A10|CSD A10]]. Would this article be better as an article about only gay erasure? Alternatively, is it worth summarising the above articles, plus asexual erasure, transgender erasure, and gay erasure, in their own sections here (with {{tl|main}})? [[User:ItsPugle|ItsPugle]] ([[User talk:ItsPugle|talk]]) 05:48, 6 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Teahouse#rfc_A58A170|Wikipedia:Teahouse]] expired 2020-08-05 14:01 ===
* Id: A58A170
* User: Bookku
* Date: 2020-08-05 05:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|971290678|PROJ 971290678}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|971337312|PROJ 971337312}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hello, greetings 

At outset itself I do apologize my bit stronger statement, is used to express my displeasure strongly enough. 

Since I came on Wikipedia, I have been observing many '''improvement notice''' hat note templates as examples of 'curator's dilemma'  turned into 'curator extremism' rather than purpose of help and encouragement those seem to have been used frequently for expression of bad faith and threatening. If at all in main space then can be understood to an extent, but even in Draft namespace I come across this 'Template:AFC submission|T'  which is massive and distracting to content contributors, and template page informs is used on 40,000+ pages .        

I am not totally against improvement notice templates but many times those can be saved for limited use. At times I have seen if a curator takes an extra step and help out in writing better an distracting improvement notice can be avoided. Any ways I am not too pleased with size of Template:AFC submission|T

Thanks and best wishes 

[[User:Bookku|Bookku]] ([[User talk:Bookku|talk]]) 05:45, 5 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Veterans' affairs#rfc_C859CC3|Talk:Veterans' affairs]] expired 2020-08-06 13:01 ===

* User: ItsPugle
* Date: 2020-07-07 12:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|966503082|POL 966503082}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|966503112|STYLE 966503112}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|971488068|POL 971488068}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|971488070|STYLE 971488070}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The current content of this page and article title suggests not, but the actual content on this page suggests that it's a disambiguation page for DVAs. Can this please be discussed and agreed as to exactly what this page is? [[User:ItsPugle|ItsPugle]] ([[User talk:ItsPugle|talk]]) 12:50, 7 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Romance (Camila Cabello album)#rfc_A15EBE5|Talk:Romance (Camila Cabello album)]] expired 2020-08-06 19:01 ===
* Id: A15EBE5
* User: MaranoFan
* Date: 2020-07-07 18:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|966552502|MEDIA 966552502}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|971534496|MEDIA 971534496}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC aims to identify which songs should be listed as singles from the ''Romance'' era, specifically regarding "[[Cry for Me]]", "[[Easy (Camila Cabello song)|Easy]]" and "[[First Man (song)|First Man]]".
* '''Option A''' - "Shameless", "Liar", "Cry for Me", "Easy", "Living Proof", "My Oh My" and "First Man" should all be listed as singles, in that order.
* '''Option B''' - Only "Shameless", "Liar", "Cry for Me", "Easy", "Living Proof" and "My Oh My" should be listed as singles.
* '''Option C''' - Only "Shameless", "Liar", "Living Proof" and "My Oh My" should be listed as singles.
:Please cast your votes in the votes section below with an optional brief comment. But use only the threaded discussion section to have any large back-and-forth arguments.--''[[User:MaranoFan|<b style="color:purple">N</b>]][[User talk:MaranoFan|<b style="color:teal">√ò</b>]]'' 18:04, 7 July 2020 (UTC)}}

* User: Bacondrum

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|971629419|POL 971629419}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Do the following sources describe NR (NF) as far-right? And, if so isn't that how we should describe them? Are these authoritative expert academic work on the subject? (I've done my best to insert links for those who can't access the print copies)
* [[Jean-Yves Camus]] and [[Nicolas Lebourg]] ''[https://books.google.com.au/books/about/Far_Right_Politics_in_Europe.html?id=_j5YDgAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover&source=kp_read_button&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q&f=false Far-Right Politics in Europe]'' 
* James Shields ''[https://books.google.com.au/books/about/The_Extreme_Right_in_France.html?id=EV2KAgAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover&source=kp_read_button&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q&f=false The Extreme Right in France: From P√©tain to Le Pen]''
* [[Michel Winock]] ''[https://books.google.com.au/books/about/Histoire_de_l_extr%C3%AAme_droite_en_France.html?hl=fr&id=gtsiAQAAIAAJ&redir_esc=y Histoire de l'Extr√™me droite en France]''
* [[Jens Rydgren]] ''[https://www.academia.edu/2671808/France_The_Front_National_Ethnonationalism_and_Populism France: The Front National, Ethnonationalism and Populism]''
* [[Nonna Mayer]] ''[https://www.researchgate.net/publication/275305516_From_Jean-Marie_to_Marine_Le_Pen_Electoral_Change_on_the_Far_Right From Jean-Marie to Marine Le Pen: Electoral Change on the Far Right]''
* [[Herbert Kitschelt]] and  Anthony McGann ''[https://oxford.universitypressscholarship.com/view/10.1093/0198293259.001.0001/acprof-9780198293255-chapter-6 France: The National Front As Prototype of the New Radical Right]''
* Edward DeClair ''[https://books.google.com.au/books/about/Politics_on_the_Fringe.html?id=t4xTc6CW78QC&printsec=frontcover&source=kp_read_button&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q&f=false Politics on the Fringe: The People, Policies, and Organization of the French National Front]''
[[User:Bacondrum|Bacondrum]] ([[User talk:Bacondrum|talk]]) 02:55, 7 August 2020 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Proposed improvements to [[Wikipedia:Proposed deletion#Nominating]]: Before nomination
#The instructions should point out that if the article is about a notable subject it is not eligible for PROD, however poor the article quality.
#They should recommend checking for sources on the internet ([[WP:Before]]) 
#They should recommend checking other language versions, which may show notability. 
#They should caution about searching for topics where the primary language does not use Latin script.

Is combining material from multiple sources to reach or imply a conclusion not explicitly stated by any of the sources [[WP:SYNTH]]? For example, when no source states that a party is "left to far-Left" but we combine multiple sources to reach or imply that conclusion. === [[Talk:National Cabinet (Australia)#rfc_332F5BC|Talk:National Cabinet (Australia)]] expired 2020-08-08 06:01 ===
* Id: 332F5BC
* User: ItsPugle
* Date: 2020-07-09 05:54:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|966787138|POL 966787138}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|971784231|POL 971784231}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hi! I'm just going through some of the founding announcements about National Cabinet and all that, and it appears that [[ScoMo]] has said "The National Cabinet will be driven by an initial single agenda - to create jobs. A job making agenda".<ref>{{Cite web|last=Morrison|first=Scott|date=29 May 2020|title=Update following National Cabinet meeting|url=https://www.pm.gov.au/media/update-following-national-cabinet-meeting|url-status=live|access-date=9 July 2020|website=Prime Minister of Australia}}</ref> It was also announced that National Cabinet will fall within a larger organisation, the "National Federation Reform Council", which is formed of National Cabinet, the Council on Federal Financial Relations and the ALGA. It also said the Council on Federal Financial Relations will report to National Cabinet.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Morrison|first=Scott|date=29 May 2020|title=Press Conference - Australian Parliament House, ACT|url=https://www.pm.gov.au/media/press-conference-australian-parliament-house-act-29may20|url-status=live|access-date=9 July 2020|website=Prime Minister of Australia}}</ref> In short, it's all a bit of a hodge-podge as to exactly what National Cabinet is... I'm thinking that to kind of reset this article a bit (considering National Cabinet went from being a meeting about COVID to being the central cooperation body for all of Australia), it might be worth creating a {{no redirect|National Federation Reform Council}} article, with sections for '''National Cabinet''', the '''Council on Federal Financial Relations''', and for '''ALGA''' (which will have a {{template|main}} hatnote)? [[User:ItsPugle|ItsPugle]] ([[User talk:ItsPugle|talk]]) 05:54, 9 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Islam-related articles#rfc_90A1EE9|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Islam-related articles]] expired 2020-08-08 18:01 ===

* User: Bookku
* Date: 2020-07-09 17:26:00

Recently the question has been arisen  specifically at an article [[Syed Jawad Naqvi]] where it keeps getting added despite constantly being removed.

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Wikipedia Awards#rfc_61BA126|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Wikipedia Awards]] expired 2020-08-09 03:01 ===
* Id: 61BA126
* User: Profczerwonka
* Date: 2020-08-07 17:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|971742142|PROJ 971742142}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|971924536|PROJ 971924536}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I believe we should create a barnstar for excellence in breaking news editing. What I mean is, when a Wikipedia article or articles is affected by some breaking news changing by the minute or hour, (e.g. the COVID-19 outbreak on the Diamond Princess Cruise ship, although that could also be covered in the general COVID article,) high quality editing that keeps a page consistent with the latest verifiable news reports is difficult and intensive work that deserves to be rewarded in this way. This seems to me to be qualitatively different work than that covered by the current events barnstar, which can be used for articles of an evolving but more stable nature, on, say, the current presidential election.

[[User:Profczerwonka|Profczerwonka]] ([[User talk:Profczerwonka|talk]]) 17:40, 7 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_04F3F4B|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2020-08-09 21:01 ===
* Id: 04F3F4B
* User: Hemiauchenia
* Date: 2020-07-16 19:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|968030864|MEDIA 968030864}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|968030868|PROP 968030868}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|973173422|MEDIA 973173422}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|973173437|PROP 973173437}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should [[YouTube]] be subject to a warn edit filter, {{strike|and/or added to [[User:XLinkBot/RevertReferencesList]], which reverts the use of a source in {{tag|ref}} tags (Note: Does not include external links) for unregistered and new users under 7 days old}} (EDIT: Youtube is already subject to a XLinkBot filter) (Per the [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_267#RfC:_IMDb|IMDb]] and [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_299#RfC%3A_Facebook|Facebook]] discussions) to discourage misuse? YouTube is currently cited over 170,000 times on Wikipedia per {{duses|YouTube.com}}. YouTube is currently [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Perennial_sources#YoutTube|described at RS/P as]]: {{quote|text=Most videos on YouTube are anonymous, self-published, and unverifiable, and should not be used at all. Content uploaded from a verified official account, such as that of a news organization, may be treated as originating from the uploader and therefore inheriting their level of reliability. However, many YouTube videos from unofficial accounts are copyright violations and should not be linked from Wikipedia, according to [[WP:COPYLINK]]. See also [[WP:YOUTUBE]] and [[WP:VIDEOLINK]].}} [[User:Hemiauchenia|Hemiauchenia]] ([[User talk:Hemiauchenia|talk]]) 19:06, 16 July 2020 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_549F05F|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2020-08-09 21:01 ===
* Id: 549F05F
* User: Hemiauchenia
* Date: 2020-07-10 20:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|967052868|MEDIA 967052868}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|967052872|SOC 967052872}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|967052873|PROP 967052873}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|972041337|MEDIA 972041337}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|972041351|SOC 972041351}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|972041361|PROP 972041361}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which of the following best describes the [[WP:RS|reliability]] of the reporting of the ''[[PinkNews]]''? {{duses|pinknews.co.uk}} has been cited around 1,500 times on Wikipedia.

*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]] as in the [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 220#Daily Mail RfC|2017 RfC]] of the ''[[Daily Mail]]'' 
Further questions:
*1. Is Pink News reliable for statements about a persons sexuality or attitudes toward LGBT issues?
*2. Should citations to Pink News be attributed and/or have an inline citation?

The current text at [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Perennial_sources#PinkNews|the perennial sources list]], which has been contested, is: {{quote|text=There is consensus that PinkNews is generally unreliable, except for quotes of a living person's self-identification of their sexual orientation. If PinkNews republishes claims from a reliable source, cite the original source instead of PinkNews.}} [[User:Hemiauchenia|Hemiauchenia]] ([[User talk:Hemiauchenia|talk]]) 20:10, 10 July 2020 (UTC)}}

* Date: 2020-08-02 14:51:00

=== [[Talk:2020 Bangalore riots#rfc_E68AC17|Talk:2020 Bangalore riots]] expired 2020-08-12 18:01 ===
* Id: E68AC17
* User: Tayi Arajakate
* Date: 2020-08-12 16:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|972546759|POL 972546759}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|972556741|POL 972556741}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the page be named '''Option 1''': "2020 Bangalore riots" or '''Option 2''': "2020 Bangalore violence"?

'''Survey'''

'''Discussion'''

* Imv, violence would be the more appropiate name per [[WP:COMMONNAME]] according to which the {{xt|"the name that is most commonly used as determined by its prevalence in a significant majority of independent, reliable English-language sources"}} should be used. An analysis of the articles used by various reliable sources (in this case news orgs) should that the term "riots" for this incident is rather conservatively used, whereas "violent protests" or "violence" are much more common. <span style="background-color:#B2BEB5;padding:2px 12px 2px 12px;font-size:10px">[[User:Tayi Arajakate|<span style="color:#660000">'''Tayi Arajakate'''</span>]] <sub>[[User talk:Tayi Arajakate|<span style="color:#660000">'''Talk'''</span>]]</sub></span> 16:08, 12 August 2020 (UTC)}}

Does the following text proposed for the Secularization section contain "neutral language" and does it present the issue from a "neutral point of view", and is it appropriate for inclusion in this article?

{{Quote box|Due to increased secularization, Christians in EU member countries face increased disenfranchisement and intolerance. According to Christian based non-profit organizations, Christians increasingly experience governmental interference with their religious liberty, freedom of expression and conscience. In the media, Christians are often portrayed using negative stereotypes and Christian student groups are excluded from institutions of higher learning.<ref>{{cite web | title =Europe: Study Reveals about 3,000 Attacks on Christian Churches and Symbols in 2019| url =https://www.acnmalta.org/2020/01/08/portugal-study-reveals-about-3000-attacks-on-christian-churches-and-symbols-in-europe-in-2019/ | website =acnmalta.org | date =8 January 2020 | access-date =8 August 2020 }}</ref> Also, desecration and vandalism of Christian sites has grown steadily in recent decades numbering in the thousands each year, particularly in France and Germany.<ref>{{cite web | title =Observatory on Intolerance and Discrimination Against Christians in Europe Report 2019 | url =https://www.intoleranceagainstchristians.eu/publications | website =intoleranceagainstchristians.eu | date =2019 | access-date =8 August 2020 }}</ref>"''}}
{{reflist talk}}

=== [[Talk:Sergei Millian#rfc_8E96421|Talk:Sergei Millian]] expired 2020-08-15 01:01 ===
* Id: 8E96421
* User: 2A00:1370:812C:25F2:15E2:FAB5:7B92:CA9C
* Date: 2020-08-01 00:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|970558971|POL 970558971}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|973031131|POL 973031131}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
After Primary Subsource (PSS) of [[Steele dossier]] was outed, russian-born ([[Kungur]], Russia) american citizen Igor Danchenko and some other people in PSS interview to FBI (Source 6 -- Sergei Millian, Source 3 -- Olga Galkina, Source 4 -- Ivan Kurilla), it turned out that no information was derived from Sergei Millian, moreover they (Igor and Sergei) never met in person and Sergei even said that it was not him that called Igor Danchenko per that interview, and he did not answer to 2 emails that Igor send him. That were still not outed source 1 and source 2 that ware partial sources to this information (and Source 3 Olga that was source to almost all other infomation in Steele dossier) in this article in both versions of Steele dossier (except for some details like "Department K in FSB" that was apparently created by Steele's other sources or Steele himself). That is obviously a bad BLP violation and moreover I already saw people recommending legal action against Wikimedia on Parler and Twitter to @sergeimillian, so WP:DOLT also applies. See latest at this time edit on this article, that should be reverted. Also ping {{u|Korny O'Near}}. Also some sources https://monsieuramerica.com/2020/03/09/dragon/ (DRAGON FISA umbrella investigation, with Crossfire Hurricane and Crossfire Fury) and https://monsieuramerica.com/2019/12/24/a-conspiracy-to-defame-sergei-millian/ and sources in latest edit. I will also attach "unreadacted" in part version of PSS interview, https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dm_ebdW9y-dRPA8OCoxbrPoFo7gHInOA/view?usp=sharing [[Special:Contributions/2A00:1370:812C:25F2:15E2:FAB5:7B92:CA9C|2A00:1370:812C:25F2:15E2:FAB5:7B92:CA9C]] ([[User talk:2A00:1370:812C:25F2:15E2:FAB5:7B92:CA9C|talk]]) 00:46, 1 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Svoboda (political party)#rfc_2241934|Talk:Svoboda (political party)]] expired 2020-08-15 04:01 ===
* Id: 2241934
* User: Bacondrum
* Date: 2020-07-19 06:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|968411981|HIST 968411981}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|968411983|POL 968411983}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|968411987|RELI 968411987}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|968411990|SOC 968411990}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|973056256|HIST 973056256}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|973056260|POL 973056260}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|973056265|RELI 973056265}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|973056268|SOC 973056268}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hi, I came across [[Svoboda (political party)|this article]] recently and noticed some glaring issues with the lede:
* First, this statement "It is positioned between the right-wing and the far-right of the political spectrum. It is widely considered a fascist and/or anti-semitic party" sounds [[WP:WEASEL|weaselly]] to me. We shouldn't be approximating these things, is the party any of those things or isn't it?
* Second, do we need a breakdown of different election results in the lede? Doesn't that kind of detail belong in the body?
* Third, if we include election results, shouldn't they be summarised? 
* Fourth, the prose are really clunky, how can they be improved? 
Thanks in advance. [[User:Bacondrum|Bacondrum]] ([[User talk:Bacondrum|talk]]) 06:03, 19 July 2020 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Which of the following best describes the [[WP:RS|reliability]] of the reporting of the [[Wen Wei Po]]? {{duses|wenweipo.com/}} has been cited around 440 times on Wikipedia.

*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]] as in the [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 220#Daily Mail RfC|2017 RfC]] of the ''[[Daily Mail]]'' --[[User:Adamant1|Adamant1]] ([[User talk:Adamant1|talk]]) 03:20, 22 July 2020 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|977516348|STYLE 977516348}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|977516351|POLICY 977516351}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should [[MOS:DEADNAME|MOS:Deadname]] be updated to say:{{pb}}In the case of [[transgender]] and [[non-binary]] people, former names should be included in article space only if the person was [[wikipedia:Notability|notable]] under that name. If included they can be introduced with either "born" or "formerly‚Äù. [Examples: [[Caitlyn Jenner]] (included), and [[Laverne Cox]] (omitted).]

Per the dignity of the person, by default assume that the name is of concern in the absence of such evidence, and minimize [[deadnaming]] as not doing so has been evidenced to cause [[wikipedia:Avoiding harm|real world harm]].{{efn|Avoid using the name, even in an infobox, even if a birth name, even if it has appeared in a [[wikipedia:Due weight|small fraction]] of [[wikipedia:Reliable sources|reliable sources]].}} [[User:Gleeanon409|Gleeanon409]] ([[User talk:Gleeanon409|talk]]) 08:20, 10 August 2020 (UTC)}}
Wikipedia should not follow NZ law and censor [redacted]'s name. Goes agianst WP:NOTCENSORED and WP:BLPNAME.

{{rfcquote|text=
In

=== [[Talk:Demagogue/Archive_3#RfC_on_Donald_Trump_inclusion | February of 2019 there was an Rfc]] expired 2020-08-15 21:01 ===
* Id: 
* User: DonkeyPunchResin
* Date: 2020-07-16 20:36:00
* RFC Text:
as to whether Trump should be listed as an example of a demagogue. No consensus was reached. Reliable mainstream sources have published a plethora of articles/books in respect to Trump/demagoguery since that Rfc. Consequently, I present you now with one question: '''should this article include opinions and/or analysis which assert that Donald Trump has characteristics of a demagogue, is a demagogue, or otherwise analyzes Trump through the lens of demagoguery?''' === [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography#rfc_FCA5E18|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography]] expired 2020-08-15 21:01 ===
* Id: FCA5E18
* User: Slugger O&#39;Toole
* Date: 2020-07-16 20:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|968038689|RELI 968038689}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|968038692|STYLE 968038692}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|973183489|RELI 973183489}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|973183496|STYLE 973183496}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose a new subsection 3.1.2 titled "Ecclesiastical titles." The content would be as follows:

:If reliable sources consistently use an ecclesiastical title (e.g. Pope, Elder, Patriarch, Sister, Cardinal), then it should be used on Wikipedia as well, at least on the first instance. It may be used on subsequent instances, if reliable sources typically use it (e.g. [[Patriarch Bartholomew]]) or if the context provided is useful. Otherwise, the subject's surname is sufficient and conforms to general encyclopedic style. In some cases, such as to avoid repetition, it may be acceptable to refer to the subject by their title alone in subsequent instances ([[John_O%27Connor_(cardinal)#Relations_with_organized_labor|e.g.]] "A non-union crew from NBC appeared at the cardinal's residence to cover one of O'Connor's press conferences.").

--[[User:Slugger O&#39;Toole|Slugger O&#39;Toole]] ([[User talk:Slugger O&#39;Toole|talk]]) 20:08, 16 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Millennials#rfc_84AF26C|Talk:Millennials]] expired 2020-08-16 07:01 ===
* Id: 84AF26C
* Date: 2020-07-17 06:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|968100072|SOC 968100072}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|973259396|SOC 973259396}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the lead be changed from: 

"Researchers and popular media use the early 1980s as starting birth years and the mid-1990s to early 2000s as ending birth years, with 1981 to 1996 a widely accepted defining range for the generation." (Status quo)

to "Researchers and popular media typically use the early 1980s as starting birth years and the mid-1990s as ending birth years, with 1981 to 1996 a widely accepted defining range for the generation."

-- 06:28, 17 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Brightest Blue#rfc_62C9C75|Talk:Brightest Blue]] expired 2020-08-16 12:01 ===
* Id: 62C9C75
* User: Lil-unique1
* Date: 2020-07-17 11:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|968128520|MEDIA 968128520}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|973289750|MEDIA 973289750}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is some difference of opinion as to what constitutes a single from an album when previously released songs are included on album's track listing but are not specifically called "singles" by the artist or record label. In the case of ''Brightest Blue'' the question is whether or not the songs: "[[Hate Me (Ellie Goulding and Juice Wrld song)|Hate Me]]", "[[Flux (Ellie Goulding song)|Flux]]", "[[Close to Me (Ellie Goulding, Diplo and Swae Lee song)|Close to Me]]" are considered singles for the purpose of album's infobox. [[User:Lil-unique1|'''<span style="color:#002a2a">Lil-</span><span style="color:#0c6e70">Unique1</span>''']] <small><span style="color:#0c6e70">-{ [[User talk:Lil-unique1|<span style="color:#002a2a">'''Talk'''</span>]] }-</span></small> 11:09, 17 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Verifiability#rfc_92F9BF0|Wikipedia talk:Verifiability]] expired 2020-08-18 23:01 ===
* Id: 92F9BF0
* User: Levivich
* Date: 2020-07-22 22:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|969241238|MEDIA 969241238}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|969241240|POLICY 969241240}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|973736190|MEDIA 973736190}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|973736195|POLICY 973736195}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Footnote 9 currently reads, in part (emphasis added):

{{tq2|Sources that may have interests other than professional considerations in the matter being reported are considered to be conflicted sources. '''Further examples of sources with conflicts of interest include but are not limited to articles by any media group that promotes the holding company of the media group or discredits its competitors'''; news reports by journalists having financial interests in the companies being reported or in their competitors; material (including but not limited to news reports, books, articles and other publications) involved in or struck down by litigation in any country, or released by parties involved in litigation against other involved parties, during, before or after the litigation; and promotional material released through media in the form of paid news reports.}}

Recently, there was a discussion at RSN, "Is CNN usable as a source for unflattering information about Fox News?", which closed with "The consensus is that CNN is a usable source for unflattering information about Fox News. Editors largely do not accept the financial COI argument to disqualify CNN." ([[Special:Permalink/968564798#Is CNN usable as a source for unflattering information about Fox News?|permalink]]) 

Should Footnote 9 be modified, e.g. to remove the part about "discredits its competitors", or in some other way? <span style="white-space:nowrap;">[[User:Levivich|Levivich]]&thinsp;<sup>[''[[Special:Contributions/Levivich|dubious]] ‚Äì [[User talk:Levivich|discuss]]'']</sup></span> 22:57, 22 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_E99BBB3|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2020-08-19 03:01 ===
* Id: E99BBB3
* User: Profczerwonka
* Date: 2020-08-07 01:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|971692079|PROP 971692079}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|973763391|PROP 973763391}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It strikes me that it would be amazing if we could get a dedicated, designated team of volunteers to start universal narrating of articles so we can present content in audio format for English language learners and persons with visual and/or learning disabilities (and anyone else who enjoys a good listen!) Screen reader technology is nice, but it lacks inflection, pronunciation, and nuance.   The current project in this vein is a good start but doesn‚Äôt quite go far enough in that it requires the user to request recording.   

[[User:Profczerwonka|Profczerwonka]] ([[User talk:Profczerwonka|talk]]) 01:59, 7 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Television#rfc_D3C5D11|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Television]] expired 2020-08-19 09:01 ===
* Id: D3C5D11
* User: LaundryPizza03
* Date: 2020-07-20 08:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|968590627|MEDIA 968590627}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|968590629|POLICY 968590629}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|973805462|MEDIA 973805462}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|973805463|POLICY 973805463}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Normally, when a series is cancelled or ended, we list the end date as when the final episode was aired/released. But sometimes, a show is taken off the air with no word as to whether it has been renewed or canceled; under current practices, we presume a series to have ended if no new episodes have aired in over a year and it has not been officially renewed. The end date is listed in the infobox and the page is added to the appropriate subcategory of [[Category:Television series endings by year]], but we do not list it on a [[List of years in television|(YEAR) in (COUNTRY) television]] page. (This is not currently mentioned in the MOS. I can't find where the consensus for this rule was decided.)

''[[The Amazing World of Gumball]]'' last aired a new episode on June 24, 2019 and has not been renewed, so it satisfies the "presumed ending" criteria. (The spinoff miniseries, ''[[Darwin's Yearbook]]'', aired later, but it doesn't count.) However, various users (including myself) have objected to this because the series has also not been confirmed to be canceled. It didn't help that the matter was already controversial from the day the possible finale was announced. Conflict over ''Gumball'''s status is the main reason why the show's article was protected today.

In light of the applicable policies/guidelines, should a series be presumed ended if no new episodes have aired in the past year? If so, which pages should list this presumed end date? ‚Äì[[User:LaundryPizza03|<b style="color:#77b">Laundry</b><b style="color:#fb0">Pizza</b><b style="color:#b00">03</b>]] ([[User talk:LaundryPizza03|<span style="color:#0d0">d</span>]][[Special:Contribs/LaundryPizza03|<span style="color:#0bf">cÃÑ</span>]]) 08:50, 20 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Banning policy#rfc_9C370F6|Wikipedia talk:Banning policy]] expired 2020-08-22 21:01 ===
* Id: 9C370F6
* Date: 2020-08-19 01:35:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|973755337|POLICY 973755337}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|974407402|POLICY 974407402}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This proposal is aimed at the addition of a namespace ban system, which prohibit users from editing a specific namespace, like project namespace. This can be a second-to-last resort before a site ban, since for extremely disruptive editors, a mainspace ban can be used before site ban. It is easy to implement since Mediawiki provides namespace blocks as well. --[[User:ThesenatorO5-2|ThesenatorO5-2]]<sup>[[User_talk:ThesenatorO5-2|argue with me]]</sup> 01:35, 19 August 2020 (UTC)}}
