Which of the following best describes the [[WP:RS|reliability]] of the reporting of the [[South China Morning Post]] (SCMP)? The South China Morning Post has been cited around 7,000 times on Wikipedia per {{duses|scmp.com}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_E21CDB3|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2020-08-23 09:01 ===
* Id: E21CDB3
* User: Maidyouneed
* Date: 2020-08-22 21:47:00

{{rfcquote|text=
What is the reliability of the aforementioned report. This is used in the context of [[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guba_mass_grave]]. Andrey Fomich Novatski is a prosecutor of the Ganja District Court of Azerbaijan. He was commissioned to create this historical report by the Azerbaijani Government under the Foriegn ministry (http://www.milliarxiv.gov.az/en/fovqelade-tehqiqat-komissiyasi), which broadly hoped to raise awareness of Armenian violence. This is within the context of the ongoing Armenian-Azerbaijani conflict and territorial claims ([[Nagorno-Karabakh_conflict]], or specifically the speech at Guba [[Anti-Armenian_sentiment_in_Azerbaijan#Statements_by_President_Ilham_Aliyev]]). The source is http://files.preslib.az/site/soyqirim/31mart_az.pdf p116. [[User:Maidyouneed|Maidyouneed]] ([[User talk:Maidyouneed|talk]]) 21:47, 22 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Verifiability#rfc_533AC91|Wikipedia talk:Verifiability]] expired 2020-08-24 00:01 ===
* Id: 533AC91
* User: Chris.sherlock
* Date: 2020-08-23 06:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|974467924|POLICY 974467924}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|974612105|POLICY 974612105}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I would like to know whether it is reasonable to note the name of the magistrate to an article that mentions that someone has been convicted. Specifically, this is a question about [[WP:ONUS]]. I personally think it is relevant and important context. I think it is good to know who the magistrate is who convicted someone, and it often makes it easier to locate the court case if you know the name of the judicial officer. What are the specific objections to include this material? I can't see how it would be a violation of [[WP:BLP]], and I certainly don't think that the judge is a trivial part of any court case! - [[User:Chris.sherlock|Chris.sherlock]] ([[User talk:Chris.sherlock|talk]]) 06:20, 23 August 2020 (UTC)}}

* Date: 2020-07-25 09:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|969424181|BIO 969424181}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|969424188|MEDIA 969424188}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|974673695|BIO 974673695}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|974673698|MEDIA 974673698}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Did you know#rfc_3A78E66|Wikipedia talk:Did you know]] expired 2020-08-27 02:01 ===
* Id: 3A78E66
* User: Yoninah
* Date: 2020-08-18 11:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|973648548|POLICY 973648548}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|975158899|POLICY 975158899}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Should the subject's birthday be considered a valid reason for a special occasion request?'''

The criteria at [[WP:DYK#Date requests]] says nothing about what a "special occasion" is. Past discussion says that it's up to the reviewer to honor the date request. But nominators are constantly asking us to promote hooks to mark a subject's birthday, or even the birthday of an actor who plays a certain character. It's my understanding that a "special occasion" refers to an anniversary, such as the 75th anniversary of the end of World War II, or the annual staging of a sports event, or some other ''significant'' date. [[Beethoven]]'s 250th birthday would obviously meet this criteria. But a random birthday is not significant and we should not be expected to scramble sets to accommodate it. [[User:Yoninah|Yoninah]] ([[User talk:Yoninah|talk]]) 11:21, 18 August 2020 (UTC)}}

# Should we include a label on Anne‚Äôs sexuality (e.g. bisexual, etc), which then places her in an LGBT category?

Should the second paragraph of the [[WP:LEDE|lede section]] be deleted?

Please !vote in the Survey section as '''Yes''' or '''Delete''' to delete, or '''No''' or '''Keep''' to keep.  Do not reply to other statements in the Survey.  Any replies can go in the Threaded Discussion.  (This will make it easier for the closer to assess consensus.)  The two editors who are having the dispute should make their statements in Statements by Proponents.  Do not reply to those statements.  You may reply to them in the Threaded Discussion.

=== [[Talk:Linux kernel#rfc_3146AF6|Talk:Linux kernel]] expired 2020-08-30 14:01 ===
* Id: 3146AF6
* User: Fabio Maria De Francesco
* Date: 2020-07-31 13:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|970734339|SCI 970734339}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|975801176|SCI 975801176}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 Does the official Linux kernel code that is maintained and  released by Mr. Linus Torvalds infringe the GPLv2 (and derived licenses or dual licensing with MIT)?

From the COPYING file that is located at the root of the Linux tree source code: 

"The Linux Kernel is provided under:

	SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0 WITH Linux-syscall-note

Being under the terms of the GNU General Public License version 2 only,
according with:

	LICENSES/preferred/GPL-2.0

With an explicit syscall exception, as stated at:

	LICENSES/exceptions/Linux-syscall-note

In addition, other licenses may also apply. Please see:

	Documentation/process/license-rules.rst

for more details.

All contributions to the Linux Kernel are subject to this COPYING file."

This morning I had to revert the umpteenth edit of the nth "contributor" that stated that the Linux licensing rules allow developers of proprietary modules to upload binary code (i.e., compiled executable objects) into the official kernel tree. Furthermore, the above mentioned editors write that Mr. Torvalds regularly distributes such executables hidden in his own git branch. This implies that Linus voluntarily breaks the GPLv2, thus making himself the leader of a gang of outlaws  

Contributors should read the entire Linux kernel article, and act with coherence with it. In more than one section of this article is clearly stated that Linux has not "binary blobs", although it is capable to locate and load them from user space. There are authoritative citations supporting it.

Please read https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/process/license-rules.html

From now on, such disruptive edits will be immediately reverted and editors will be reported for vandalism. [[User:Fabio Maria De Francesco|Fabio Maria De Francesco]] ([[User talk:Fabio Maria De Francesco|talk]]) 13:13, 31 July 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Australian Unemployed Workers' Union#rfc_D3C4AD7|Talk:Australian Unemployed Workers' Union]] expired 2020-09-01 09:01 ===
* Id: D3C4AD7
* User: 200.118.112.139
* Date: 2020-09-01 06:35:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|976107039|POL 976107039}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|976121059|POL 976121059}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This article is the subject of a dispute between several users regarding its neutrality. The article appears to rely heavily upon a mix of sources of questionable quality (pop news websites such as Pedestrian.tv and Junkee) as well as many citations linking directly back to the organisation's own website. Sections of the article read more like a brochure rather than a neutral description of the entity. The membership figure is disputed, with no reliable source confirming a '16,000 member' figure with the [https://www.consumer.vic.gov.au/clubs-and-fundraising/incorporated-associations/search-for-an-incorporated-association?id=dac3af41-48b7-44d3-86e4-fbbd99eb3e8a Incorporated Associations Register from the State Government of Victoria] showing far less than this. Discussion on the talk page has not been fruitful as the official records from the Victorian Government are being rejected as not credible by single-purpose accounts. Further to this, SPAs have blanked other user comments on the talk page and attempts to place a neutrality template on the article in an effort to promote discussion and improvement of the topic have been reverted. Any outside comment on this matter and the editing activity would be much appreciated for clarification and hopefully resolution. [[Special:Contributions/200.118.112.139|200.118.112.139]] ([[User talk:200.118.112.139|talk]]) 06:35, 1 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_35BA14A|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2020-09-02 03:01 ===
* Id: 35BA14A
* User: Flyer22 Frozen
* Date: 2020-08-09 02:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|971924529|MEDIA 971924529}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|971924533|SOC 971924533}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|976286382|MEDIA 976286382}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|976286399|SOC 976286399}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which of the following best describes the [[WP:RS|reliability]] of the reporting of the [[PETA]]? 

*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply, such as [[WP:CONTEXTMATTERS]]
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Only reliable for [[WP:About self]] matters
Further questions:
*1. Is PETA reliable for statements about a person being a vegetarian or vegan? What about when the person tells PETA that they are a vegetarian or vegan? 
*2. Should citations to PETA be attributed and/or have an inline citation? 
*3. Are PETA awards and commentary about a person making PETA's "sexiest vegan" list to be excluded from Wikipedia articles unless covered by a secondary source? Should such material be included at all, such as in the "Public image" section? [[User:Flyer22 Frozen|Flyer22 Frozen]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Frozen|talk]]) 02:27, 9 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (royalty and nobility)#rfc_14B4E0D|Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (royalty and nobility)]] expired 2020-09-02 19:01 ===
* Id: 14B4E0D
* User: GoodDay
* Date: 2020-09-02 13:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|976345509|STYLE 976345509}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|976406275|STYLE 976406275}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I am familiar with the naming conventions associated with [[WP:SOVEREIGN]] specifically at No. 4. However, there are a lot of exceptions to the rule. Examples: [[Joanna of Castile]], [[Philippe of Belgium]], [[Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands]]. Do you think we should change the conventions to determine how we should title monarchs without a roman numeral next to their name.
:What are you suggesting they be changed to? Seeing as there's been a trend to move '''Monarch of country''' to just '''Monarch''', lately. Perhaps some of the 'non numbered' monarchs could be move to just '''Monarch''', as well. [[User:GoodDay|GoodDay]] ([[User talk:GoodDay|talk]]) 13:40, 2 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_B538144|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2020-09-04 16:01 ===
* Id: B538144
* User: Buidhe
* Date: 2020-08-05 18:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|971596105|POL 971596105}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|971674143|MEDIA 971674143}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|971959195|PROP 971959195}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|976719633|MEDIA 976719633}}

* RFC Text:

What is the reliability of ''[[Global Times]]'' ({{duses|globaltimes.cn}})? It is used in more than a thousand Wikipedia articles.
*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]] as in the [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 220#Daily Mail RfC|2017 RfC]] of the ''[[Daily Mail]]''?

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_B299869|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2020-09-04 21:01 ===
* Id: B299869
* User: CaptainEek
* Date: 2020-08-05 20:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|971391300|STYLE 971391300}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|971391303|POLICY 971391303}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|971391306|TECH 971391306}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|975020164|POLICY 975020164}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|976762211|STYLE 976762211}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|976762219|TECH 976762219}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Many of you will note that the erstwhile [[User:Citation bot]] was blocked about two months ago. After copious discussion, the block has revealed some underlying issues about how we deal with citations, that seem to lack community consensus. The initial block was over Citation bot unlinking sources in reference titles if it was already linked to something like a DOI, or other unique identifier. I thank [[User:Levivich]] for the wording of the questions, whose text I snatched verbatim from [[WP:BOTN]] :) [[User:CaptainEek|<span style="color:#6a1f7f">'''CaptainEek'''</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:CaptainEek|<span style="font-size:82%"><span style="color:#a479e5">''Edits Ho Cap'n!''</span></span>]]</sup>[[Special:Contributions/CaptainEek|‚öì]] 20:39, 5 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_E21BE72|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2020-09-04 21:01 ===
* Id: E21BE72
* User: CaptainEek
* Date: 2020-08-05 20:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|971391309|PROP 971391309}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|976762221|PROP 976762221}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose that we '''formally deprecate the <u>inline</u> parenthetical citation style'''.

Wikipedia has [[WP:CITEVAR|long valued different styles of citation]], and we do formally protect a wide range of citation styles. There was even a 2006 ArbCom case that ruled on the issue. However that was 14 years ago, and a lot has changed since then. As Wikipedia moves forward, and our style grows more standardized and formal, I question the utility of the rarely used [[WP:PAREN|parenthetical citation style]]. This style exists because it is used in scientific papers and college essays. However, papers and essays do not have the benefit of being online; thus they cannot have expandable footnotes with fancy coding. Parenthetical citations also clutter the text and make reading more difficult. See for example [[Actuary]], which is one the bare handful of FAs with parenthetical citation style. It includes sentences like {{tq|In various studies, being an actuary was ranked number one or two multiple times since 2010 (Thomas 2012, Weber 2013, CareerCast 2015) and in the top 20 for most of the past decade (CareerCast 2014, CareerCast 2016, CNN Money 2017, CareerCast 2019).}} which is cluttered, and unnecessarily long because of the citations. At the end of the day, our goal is to serve the [[WP:READER]]. The best way we can do that is to provide easy to read articles, free from inline clutter. [[User:CaptainEek|<span style="color:#6a1f7f">'''CaptainEek'''</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:CaptainEek|<span style="font-size:82%"><span style="color:#a479e5">''Edits Ho Cap'n!''</span></span>]]</sup>[[Special:Contributions/CaptainEek|‚öì]] 20:38, 5 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Help talk:IPA/Italian#rfc_D8D063E|Help talk:IPA/Italian]] expired 2020-09-05 13:01 ===
* Id: D8D063E
* Date: 2020-08-06 12:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|971488065|LANG 971488065}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|976854409|LANG 976854409}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Word-initial gemination in Standard Italian occurs in the following contexts ([https://www.academia.edu/download/49706939/Phonetic_variation_in_Italian_consonant_20161018-27160-259sxr.pdf Payne 2005]; [https://www.cambridge.org/core/services/aop-cambridge-core/content/view/3BD6A21BBF1225A1ED46F6E984131AD3/S0025100305002148a.pdf/sound_pattern_of_standard_italian_as_compared_with_the_varieties_spoken_in_florence_milan_and_rome.pdf Bertinetto & Loporcaro 2005]; [https://books.google.com/books?id=RszKAgAAQBAJ Maiden & Robustelli 2014]):

*"Intrinsic" gemination: {{IPA|/ts, dz,  É, …≤,  é/}} following any vowel, as in ''la '''sci'''arpa''
*[[Syntactic gemination]] (''raddoppiamento sintattico''):
**Any consonant following a stressed vowel (and not followed by an occlusive), as in ''virt√π '''d'''iversa''
**Any consonant following a certain preposition or conjunction (and not followed by an occlusive), as in ''e '''R'''oma''
**{{IPA|/d/}} in ''dio'' or its inflected form following any vowel, as in ''gli '''d'''ei''

Which of these should be reflected in transcriptions using the [[Help:IPA/Italian]] key? 12:17, 6 August 2020 (UTC)}}


=== [[Help talk:IPA/Italian#rfc_30815BB|Help talk:IPA/Italian]] expired 2020-09-05 13:01 ===
* Id: 30815BB
* Date: 2020-08-06 12:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|971495399|LANG 971495399}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|976854409|LANG 976854409}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In transcriptions using the [[Help:IPA/Italian]] key, should word-internal preconsonantal {{IPA|[s]}} or {{IPA|[z]}} preceding a stressed vowel be shown as tautosyllabic with the following consonant(s), as in {{IPA|[toÀàskaÀêna, eÀàspr…õsso]}}, or heterosyllabic, as in {{IPA|[tosÀàkaÀêna, esÀàpr…õsso]}}? 12:16, 6 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox concert#rfc_63AFEE4|Template talk:Infobox concert]] expired 2020-09-06 15:01 ===
* Id: 63AFEE4
* User: Status
* Date: 2020-08-07 14:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|971674143|MEDIA 971674143}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|977034447|MEDIA 977034447}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I purpose that we update the chronology to be similar to that of [[Template:Infobox album]]. And by that I mean instead of:
* last_tour
* this_tour
* next_tour
We would have:
* prev_tour
* prev_year
* year (and the title will be added automatically, like it is on the album infobox, but the year is required since tours can span multiple different years)
* next_tour
* next_year
‚Äî&nbsp;[[User:Status|<span title="User page" style="color:black;">Status</span>]]&nbsp;([[User talk:Status|<span title="Talk">talk</span>]] ¬∑ [[Special:Contributions/Status|<span title="Contribs">contribs</span>]]) 14:50, 7 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Superstition#rfc_AE2F8F6|Talk:Superstition]] expired 2020-09-06 19:01 ===
* Id: AE2F8F6
* User: Bookku
* Date: 2020-09-04 06:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|976659089|SCI 976659089}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|976951747|RELI 976951747}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|976951749|SOC 976951749}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|977069619|SCI 977069619}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|977069624|RELI 977069624}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|977069627|SOC 977069627}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
While some questions are raised at [[Talk:Superstitions in Muslim societies]] about article [[Superstitions in Muslim societies]]  IMHO wider attention, consultation and  consensus is preferable that is why creating RfC here. I could see following points need to be brainstormed.

1) Is word 'superstition'  positive one?, whether  'folk belief' or something similar would be appropriate instead ?

2) Whether same  definition as of main [[Superstition]] article should apply to rest of superstition article or it should be different ?

3) How and what kind of exemptions should be allowed to religious, folk and cultural beliefs to avoid them being covered in superstition related articles. 

4.1) Superstition related article titles  should be Communities oriented, religion oriented 

4.2) for example Superstitions in Muslim societies covers few non-religious superstition among Bangladeshi pregnant women ? Should such coverage be allowed ? Is it leading to [[WP:Coatrack]] issues.

4.3) Alternate name suggestions for Superstitions in Muslim societies are or [[Superstition in the Islamic world]], [[Islamic views of superstition]] Whether such change will be able to accommodate such superstitions not having religious standing but exists in communities as example given above?

4.4) Or another suggestion has come to consider title  [[Superstition in the Muslim world]]?

4.5) When Criticism of Religion related articles do exist whether separate superstition related articles focusing communities or religion are needed at all? 

My personal opinions are obviously different, but I have attempted to be as neutral as possible,  What are your opinions ? Let us brainstorm.

[[User:Bookku|Bookku]] ([[User talk:Bookku|talk]]) 06:18, 4 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox person#rfc_35F229C|Template talk:Infobox person]] expired 2020-09-06 22:01 ===
* Id: 35F229C
* Date: 2020-08-07 21:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_21E3000|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2020-09-06 23:01 ===
* Id: 21E3000
* User: Hemiauchenia
* Date: 2020-08-26 16:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|975082515|MEDIA 975082515}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|975082520|PROP 975082520}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|978478864|MEDIA 978478864}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|978478866|PROP 978478866}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What is the [[WP:RS|reliability]] of the [[Daily Star (United Kingdom)]]? 

*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]] as in the [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 220#Daily Mail RfC|2017 RfC]] of the ''[[Daily Mail]]'' 
[[User:Hemiauchenia|Hemiauchenia]] ([[User talk:Hemiauchenia|talk]]) 16:53, 26 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Politics/Political parties#rfc_24D093B|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Politics/Political parties]] expired 2020-09-06 23:01 ===
* Id: 24D093B
* User: Bacondrum
* Date: 2020-08-07 23:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|972365495|POL 972365495}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|977099560|POL 977099560}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
If one reliable source says a party is A: "right", and another reliable source says they are B: "far-right" and we join A and B together to imply a conclusion C: "right to far right" that is not mentioned by either of the sources. Is this an improper editorial [[WP:SYNTHESIS]] of published material or [[WP:OR]]? [[User:Bacondrum|Bacondrum]] ([[User talk:Bacondrum|talk]]) 23:00, 7 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (people)#rfc_86A65B5|Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (people)]] expired 2020-09-07 15:01 ===
* Id: 86A65B5
* User: Hodgdon&#39;s secret garden
* Date: 2020-09-07 13:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|977200873|BIO 977200873}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|977208604|BIO 977208604}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
W rgd [[wp:Middle initials]]: Some newspapers' style books recommend middle initials, others' don't. E.g. the Washington Post will write "Jessica A. Krug" (about a tenured assoc. professor involved in identity scandal) in an article itself, which is abbrev.'d to "Jessica Krug" within that same article's headline: https://nowthisnews.com/news/george-washington-university-professor-reveals-she-fabricated-her-racial-identity .  All other factors being equal (for example, it's often the case that academics' writings will credit them with their middle initials but mentions of these same academics in news reports will be without them) - '''WP's style book ought to come out in favor of one position or the other.'''--[[User:Hodgdon&#39;s secret garden|Hodgdon&#39;s secret garden]] ([[User talk:Hodgdon&#39;s secret garden|talk]]) 13:55, 7 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:External links#rfc_3C45053|Wikipedia talk:External links]] expired 2020-09-08 07:01 ===
* Id: 3C45053
* User: Beetstra
* Date: 2020-08-09 06:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|971945058|STYLE 971945058}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|971945059|POLICY 971945059}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|971945063|PROP 971945063}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|977331730|STYLE 977331730}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|977331743|POLICY 977331743}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|977331747|PROP 977331747}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The [[Wikipedia:External links]] guideline provides advice about how external links should normally be formatted.  Most editors use [[:Category:External link templates|external link templates]] such {{tl|official website}} or {{tl|IMDb title}}, or simple formatting, such as <code><nowiki>[https://www.example.com Official website]</nowiki></code>.  A few editors have recently been converting these links to [[Wikipedia:Citation templates]].  Should the [[WP:ELCITE]] section of this guideline prohibit, or at least strongly discourage, the use of citation templates in the ==External links== section?  --[[User:Beetstra|Dirk Beetstra]] <sup>[[User_Talk:Beetstra|<span style="color:#0000FF;">T</span>]] [[Special:Contributions/Beetstra|<span style="color:#0000FF;">C</span>]]</sup> 06:34, 9 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Orthodox Christianity#rfc_D38BF92|Talk:Orthodox Christianity]] expired 2020-09-08 21:01 ===
* Id: D38BF92
* User: MarcusTraianus
* Date: 2020-09-08 10:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|977359201|RELI 977359201}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|977366435|HIST 977366435}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|977437798|HIST 977437798}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|977437804|RELI 977437804}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In order to avoid the war of edits, I invite the entire Wikipedia community to discuss such a complex issue. The problem is the following: whether to leave the article on Orthodox Christianity or not. I stand to leave. First, without this article, it is impossible to understand the culture and history of Russia. Secondly, I believe that the Orthodox Christianity article should be separate from the Orthodox Church article, since Orthodox Christianity is not homogeneous, there is no single church, but a common religious tradition. After all, this topic affects millions of people and their culture. Not having an article about Orthodox Christianity would be strange. [[User:MarcusTraianus|MarcusTraianus]] ([[User talk:MarcusTraianus|talk]]) 10:05, 8 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Sushant Singh Rajput#rfc_B1B909B|Talk:Sushant Singh Rajput]] expired 2020-09-09 06:01 ===

{{rfcquote|text=
Since this discussion largely seems to have sputtered out, I think it's time we discuss in more length what should actually be in the infobox, with a<s>n informal</s> request for comment. Bearing in mind what the reliable sources are reporting, our options boil down to:
#'''Mechanism only''': The infobox just reads "Asphyxia due to hanging", [[WP:Reliable sources|''with sources to back it up.'']]
#'''Mechanism and manner''': The infobox reads "Suicide by hanging", ''with sources to back it up.''
#'''Mechanism, with an investigation note''': The infobox reads "Asphyxia due to hanging, manner under investigation", ''with sources to back both up''.
Since no credible source is even considering it as a possibility, [[WP:UNDUE|"he was murdered"]] is not an option and will not be entertained.  ‚Äî[[User:J√©sk√© Couriano|<i style="color: #1E90FF;">A little blue Bori</i>]] [[User talk:J√©sk√© Couriano|<span style="color: #228B22">v^_^v</span>]] <sup><small>[[Special:Contributions/J√©sk√© Couriano|Hasteur Hasteur Ha-- oh....]]</small></sup> 18:42, 31 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:People by year#rfc_49BED46|Wikipedia talk:People by year]] expired 2020-09-10 11:01 ===
* Id: 49BED46
* User: ExcitedEngineer
* Date: 2020-08-11 10:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|972528637|POLICY 972528637}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|972528642|PROP 972528642}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|977691391|POLICY 977691391}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|977691392|PROP 977691392}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In my opinion, the vast majority of the categories in births by year and deaths by year are overpopulated. They have grown so large that they no longer serve their intended purpose, which is so readers can [[WP:CAT|"browse and quickly find sets of pages on topics that are defined by those characteristics"]]. The worst culprit, {{cl|1988 births}}, contains 16,930 articles, spread out over 85 pages. Nobody browses that many pages, let alone finds something quickly on them. The solution is easy: subcategorisation. First by month, then by date, e.g. 1900 births > January 1900 births > January 1, 1900 births. Note that, unlike the categories that have consistently been deleted at [[WP:CFD|CFD]], they refer to an exact date of birth. While in the early days of Wikipedia, it would have constituted overcategorisation, by now it is needed to keep the categories usable. I do realise that this is a monumental task if done manually, but I suppose an editor who is savvy with bots should be able to let a bot do most of the work. [[User:ExcitedEngineer|ExcitedEngineer]] ([[User talk:ExcitedEngineer|talk]]) 10:12, 11 August 2020 (UTC)}}

Should the lead of this article include criticisms of Israel's occupation of the Palestinian territories and its annexations of the Golan Heights and East Jerusalem where those annexations are mentioned? Should the lead include Israel's settlement project and the sustained condemnations of that project from the international community? [[User talk:Nableezy|Nableezy]] 16:47, 11 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:White Flags#rfc_C3A05DA|Talk:White Flags]] expired 2020-09-10 21:01 ===
* Id: C3A05DA
* User: Ex Parte
* Date: 2020-09-10 05:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|977662705|HIST 977662705}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|977765343|HIST 977765343}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This article refers to an allegation that the White Flags are U.S.-backed but only cites in support https://iicss.iq, a source of dubious credibility.  Is this a reliable source?  [https://en.m.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?search=iicss.iq&fulltext=search&ns0=1| This article appears to contain the only citation to that source on the English Wikipedia.] And to my knowledge, no established reliable source repeats the allegation in question.  In fact, reliable sources have actually documented confrontations between the U.S. and the White Flags which tend to refute the idea that they are collaborators.

I'm wondering: '''is there any good reason to keep the allegation of U.S. support in light of these considerations?'''  I welcome and appreciate any input. -- [[User:Ex Parte|'''Ex''']][[User:Ex Parte|<span style ="color: #D47C14">'''Parte'''</span>]] [[User talk:Ex Parte|<sup>'''talk'''</sup>]] 05:03, 10 September 2020 (UTC)}}

* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|972412577|HIST 972412577}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|972412584|POL 972412584}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|977779513|HIST 977779513}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|977779519|POL 977779519}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I got to the [[Austria-Hungary]] Wiki article some time ago and immediately noticed it displayed a wrong flag - in the place of the "country" flag, a "civil ensign" created for being used by civilian ships. As the article states, the country had no official flag, but the Habsburg flag, which as the article also shows was the official flag of both the [[Kingdom_of_Hungary_(1526‚Äì1867)|Kingdom of Hungary]] and the [[Austrian Empire]], was frequently used as an official flag. Since there existed no official flag, I believe the article should just not have any flag at all (like in the German wiki). I believe there is absolutely no reason why a naval "civil ensign" should be displayed in the place of the country flag. The exactly same point has apparently been made throughout the years - [[Talk:Austria-Hungary/Archive_1#Flag_of_Austria-Hungary|15 years ago]] there was consensus that it was wrong but after the correction someone re-added the wrong civil ensign without discussion; in 2016, [[Talk:Austria-Hungary/Archive_3|another user]] pointed out the same mistake, and the only response was agreeing with his comment and presenting a historical source in which the black-and-yellow Habsburg flag was used for the country; finally, in 2019, [[Talk:Austria-Hungary/Archive_4#(Controversial?)_change_to_Flag_of_Austria-Hungary|yet another user]] politely indicated that the flag was wrong, only 3 people participated in the discussion which was therefore short of a consensus, but yet another user concluded it was sensible to add the yellow-and-black flag to the article, except that it was removed afterwards by the same user who has removed it twice today. So I think we need the help of some experts here, which would be very much appreciated. Thanks. [[Special:Contributions/213.245.147.96|213.245.147.96]] ([[User talk:213.245.147.96|talk]]) 22:27, 11 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_5037BAC|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2020-09-11 15:01 ===
* Id: 5037BAC
* User: FDW777
* Date: 2020-09-11 10:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|977855092|PROP 977855092}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|977882344|PROP 977882344}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which of the following best describes the [[WP:RS|reliability]] of wikitia.com?
*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]]

''' Responses (wikitia) '''

*'''Option 4''' While the main page of wikitia says {{tq|the encyclopedia where only verified editors who have proven records can edit an article on a particular topic or field}}, this appears to be a load of rubbish. For example see the history of [[Draft:Mohammed Abu El-Naga]]. The [https://wikitia.com/wiki/Mohammed_Abu_El-Naga corresponding article at wikitia] says it was copied from that draft, on 15 June according to the history. But then if you go back to the history of the draft you see [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Draft%3AMohammed_Abu_El-Naga&type=revision&diff=966534207&oldid=966508610 this edit] on 7 July adding the wikitia article as a reference, which is as circular as it gets. This is a pattern that's repeated at [[Draft:Diana Sim√°n]] ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Draft%3ADiana_Sim%C3%A1n&type=revision&diff=973503154&oldid=972267923 offending edit]), [[Draft:Gowri Nadella]] ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Draft%3AGowri_Nadella&type=revision&diff=974515076&oldid=972623221 offending edit]). So while wikitia may claim to be [[Citizendium]] type model, all they do is copy and paste drafts from here. Listing so it can be formally deprecated for edit filter warnings. [[User:FDW777|FDW777]] ([[User talk:FDW777|talk]]) 10:49, 11 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Women in Red#rfc_C57F200|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Women in Red]] expired 2020-09-13 07:01 ===
* Id: C57F200
* User: Bookku
* Date: 2020-08-21 05:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|974118830|PROJ 974118830}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|978156451|PROJ 978156451}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 What do you feel about depiction of Women's rights issues in Country name articles?

What do I mean by Country name articles? 
:For example [[USA]] [[France]] [[Russia]] [[China]] to [[Djibouti]] any of [[List of sovereign states|193 UN member states]] 

Many times I browse country name articles just to find what sort of information article gives about status of women in respective countries, and personally I do have reservations the way poorly most of articles cover women rights issues in respective countries. 

:1) Have you visited Wikipedia article page of Your own country, Your country of residence, if different from country of citizenship. Whether article represents Women's rights issue adequately?
:2) If not, then do you feel need of country name articles to cover women's rights issues better.
:3) Or do you opposed to the very idea of Country name articles to cover Women's rights issues in their own countries. If opposed what are the reasons you will push forwards including personal ones like to hide limitations in your country. 
:4) If you are opposed then what are best Wikipedia policies which can shield your country from depiction of Women rights issues and help in soft-censorship. Like of [[WP:BITE|How to bite]],[[WP:COATRACK]],[[WP:CFORK]] suggest more. 
:Please don't be surprised or stressed, Wikipedians are good @ doing that to keep women in good humor. So take all such reasons humorously and easy, if you don't agree with ever eager curators who can throw policy document and interpretations at you with ease :)

Your comments please. 

{{Ping|Rosguill}} May be you want to help by assisting by wikisplaining on some more policies, then you are most welcome.

[[User:Bookku|Bookku]] ([[User talk:Bookku|talk]]) 05:38, 21 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Did you know/Preparation areas#rfc_8C6FAD6|Wikipedia talk:Did you know/Preparation areas]] expired 2020-09-13 21:01 ===
* Id: 8C6FAD6
* User: PythonSwarm
* Date: 2020-09-13 02:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|978132515|POLICY 978132515}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|978259012|POLICY 978259012}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Since Wikipedia is free-domain licensed, there are no such thing as article ownership, such as the following:
 N1
 Users are encouraged to help out by preparing updates in the six prep areas. You don't have to be an administrator. Note that promoting your own articles  is generally discouraged, and promoting your <u>own articles</U> before they have been independently verified is disallowed. When possible, it is also best to  avoid promoting the same article that you reviewed, nominated, or created. (It is almost invariably possible to avoid this conflict of interest, so eschew  such promotions. Ask for assistance at WT:DYK if you've run into a seemingly intractable situation.)
It is better to change the own article to "articles one authored".
-- [[User:PythonSwarm|PythonSwarm]]   <sup>[[User talk:PythonSwarm|T]]  &#124;   [[Special:Contribs/PythonSwarm|C]]   &#124;   [[Special:CentralAuth/PythonSwarm|G]] </sup> 02:33, 13 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Alternative for Germany#rfc_6F0BBB0|Talk:Alternative for Germany]] expired 2020-09-15 00:01 ===
* Id: 6F0BBB0
* User: Bacondrum
* Date: 2020-09-05 23:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|976937212|MEDIA 976937212}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|976937222|POL 976937222}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|976937224|SOC 976937224}}

{{rfcquote|text=
If a news media outlet refers to a parties ideological position as say "radical-left" in dozens of articles covering the subject, would it be appropriate to then give a contrary description of the party as "centre-left" based on a single article from the exact same outlet? === [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Lead section#rfc_7BF02E5|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Lead section]] expired 2020-09-15 00:01 ===
* Id: 7BF02E5
* User: Jorge Stolfi
* Date: 2020-08-15 23:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|974556914|STYLE 974556914}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|974556920|POLICY 974556920}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|974556921|TECH 974556921}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|978446073|STYLE 978446073}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|978446075|POLICY 978446075}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|978446081|TECH 978446081}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Navigational sidebars should not be used in the lead.

Technical note: <small>Navigational sidebars are not visible on mobile versions of Wikipedia representing approximately 60 percent of readers. (i.e. [[History of the United States|Desk top]]  vs [https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_the_United_States Mobile version])</small>

Rationale:
The MOS should strongly reject the use of navboxes (sidebars) in the lede.  There are many reasons, such as
*The top right corner should be reserved for an image related to the article's topic.
*Wikilinks are the best way for readers to navigate between aticles.  Few if any readers will want to hop between articles by topic.  Practically none will do so by using the sidebars.
*As a rule, an article belongs to many general topics.  Which one gets to put its sidebar there?
*Editing and inserting sidebars uses a lot of editor brainpower that could be used in more productive ways.
*Sidebars imply a division of knowledge into topics that is at best artificial, at worst misleading and mind-limiting.
*Readers who want to read broadly on articles about a given topic are much better served by a regular article on that topic, that points to specific articles trough wikilinks. The "tab" feature and back" button of most browsers makes it unnecessary to have a sidebar on every article with that topic.
*Sidebars tend to split Wikipedia into a federation topical encyclopedias, each "owned" by a Wikiproject -- which inevitably tends to be dominated by a few editors who create their own rules of style and contents, and are unconsciously hostile to "outsider" editors.
For these and other reasons, the MOS should say "no" to navboxes in the lede. Existing sidebars should be merged into the articles about the respective topics, or, at worst, turned into navbars at the bottom of the article.--[[User:Jorge Stolfi|Jorge Stolfi]] ([[User talk:Jorge Stolfi|talk]]) 23:06, 15 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion#rfc_191FB87|Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion]] expired 2020-09-15 02:01 ===
* Id: 191FB87
* User: PythonSwarm
* Date: 2020-09-06 10:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|977005820|POLICY 977005820}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|978460321|POLICY 978460321}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I want to ask what is the minimum limit for the ''substantial edits'' criteria, because a bad faith editor can add some minor edits, so it does not meet G5. e.g: A banned editor A created a page, and another B added a null edit by appending <code><nowiki><!----></nowiki></code> to the end. Should this page still meet G5? This RfC is for reaching consensus or uniamity about this problem. -- [[User:PythonSwarm|PythonSwarm]]   <sup>[[User talk:PythonSwarm|Talk]]  &#124;   [[Special:Contribs/PythonSwarm|Contribs]]   &#124;   [[Special:CentralAuth/PythonSwarm|Global]]</sup> 10:01, 6 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_C67161D|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2020-09-15 12:01 ===
* Id: C67161D
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|976923846|MEDIA 976923846}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_61BACF3|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2020-09-15 12:01 ===
* Id: 61BACF3
* User: Coffeeandcrumbs
* Date: 2020-08-27 10:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|975209007|MEDIA 975209007}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|975209011|POL 975209011}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|975209014|PROP 975209014}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|979034026|MEDIA 979034026}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|979034037|PROP 979034037}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What is the [[WP:RS|reliability]] of the ''[[New York Post]]''? 

*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]] as in the [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 220#Daily Mail RfC|2017 RfC]] of the ''[[Daily Mail]]'' ---&nbsp;[[User talk:Coffeeandcrumbs|<span style="color:blue;">C</span>]]&amp;[[Special:Contributions/Coffeeandcrumbs|<span style="color:#663366;">C</span>&nbsp;(]][[User talk:Coffeeandcrumbs|<span style="color:#ba0000">Coffeeandcrumbs</span>]]) 10:17, 27 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Nonviolence#rfc_7328889|Talk:Nonviolence]] expired 2020-09-15 16:01 ===
* Id: 7328889
* User: Robynthehode
* Date: 2020-08-16 15:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|973314140|RELI 973314140}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|978551745|RELI 978551745}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The dispute is whether the text {{u|Ktokolvek5}} wants to include about the 'Czechoslovakia's non-violent defense against the Soviet occupation' is undue according to [[WP:UNDUE]]. My argument is that this article is about the religious and philosophical theories of nonviolence and adding a section about a specific nonviolent campaign as suggested is undue. There are other articles that cover some of the information suggested for inclusion such as [[Non-violent resistance]] and [[Prague Spring]] but I have suggested creating a new article as the best option. {{u|Ktokolvek5}} has reiterated numerous times that it is too important a subject to be included elsewhere. This is I think also against [[WP:NOTADVOCACY]]. I have also commented that the text for inclusion is not up to Wikipedia style standard for an encyclopaedia. [[User:Robynthehode|Robynthehode]] ([[User talk:Robynthehode|talk]]) 15:02, 16 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_9DD9B4F|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2020-09-16 03:01 ===
* Id: 9DD9B4F
* User: Sam-2727
* Date: 2020-09-04 20:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|977005820|POLICY 977005820}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|978635129|POLICY 978635129}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Some users with a conflict of interest or being paid to edit struggle to properly format edit requests. The [[WP:Edit Request Wizard]] handles the formatting automatically, and is supposed to encourage proper wording of requests. Should this tool be mentioned in policy and information pages regarding [[WP:Conflict of interest]] and paid editing? Specifically, I propose linking to it in these pages:
* [[WP:Paid-contribution disclosure#Conflict of interest guideline]],
* in the [[WP:COI]] guideline whenever the {{template|request edit}} template is mentioned,
* in the [[WP:Simple conflict of interest edit request]], and
* on [[WP:Edit requests]].

Comments also welcome on improvements to the wizard itself.

[[User:Sam-2727|Sam-2727]] ([[User talk:Sam-2727|talk]]) 20:02, 4 September 2020 (UTC)}}

The lead section should be changed to something like this: <br />
<code>Taiwan is a province of the PRC, although it is politically independent, the political status of Taiwan is unclear.</code><br />

Those who insult me because of ''my'' perspective please see [[WP:NPA]].

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_A9CFA1F|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2020-09-18 18:01 ===
* Id: A9CFA1F
* User: ScottishNardualElf
* Date: 2020-09-01 08:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|976719629|HIST 976719629}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|976719642|POL 976719642}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|981269065|HIST 981269065}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|981269074|POL 981269074}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Following on from the discussion started here:

[[Talk:Donald Trump#What happened to the succession boxes?]]

How does the community feel about succession boxes and their inclusion in the articles about US Presidents specifically? The following three options were presented on the talk page above:

# The succession boxes should be included in all U.S. presidents' BLPs.
# The succession boxes should be omitted from all U.S. presidents' BLPs.
# One size does not fit all. Cross-article consistency is less important than flexibility. Decide on a case-by-case basis at article level.

I genuinely believe they help navigation between articles, though they could often be trimmed down to avoid trivial items, and if they are too large, they can be collapsed into the Offices and distinctions box. That way if you are looking for them, they are there, but if not they are not taking up a lot of space at the bottom of the article. [[User:ScottishNardualElf|ScottishNardualElf]] ([[User talk:ScottishNardualElf|talk]]) 08:55, 1 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:International Bureau of Weights and Measures#rfc_E8983CB|Talk:International Bureau of Weights and Measures]] expired 2020-09-20 15:01 ===
* Id: E8983CB
* User: Hqb
* Date: 2020-08-21 14:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|974186349|SCI 974186349}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|979403222|SCI 979403222}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the abbreviation "IBWM" be listed in the organization infobox, alongside the far more common "BIPM"? See the [[Talk:International Bureau of Weights and Measures#Use of the English name (and acronym) for this organisation|long discussion thread]] above for arguments from both sides. The main viewpoints seem to be:
* '''Yes''': it's been used by reliable sources
* '''No''': it's only used by an insignificant minority of such sources
* '''Compromise''': include it, but with an explicit caveat, such as "(unofficial)" or "(rare)"
Please comment. If supporting option 3, please also suggest a specific wording or formatting. Thanks, [[User:Hqb|Hqb]] ([[User talk:Hqb|talk]]) 14:33, 21 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:America's Got Talent#rfc_5AFBDAC|Talk:America's Got Talent]] expired 2020-09-22 21:01 ===
* Id: 5AFBDAC
* User: GUtt01
* Date: 2020-09-03 19:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|976585689|MEDIA 976585689}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|979797729|MEDIA 979797729}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This is a question I wanna get asked and discussed about. Every season article of ''America's Got Talent'' has its live round tables denoting the act of a participant, as much as the overview table itself, but is this really necessary to do, or should that column be removed and act type confined to the overview table?

* '''Yes''': Agree if you think that the column should be removed from these tables, and the act type retained in the Overview table.
* '''No''': Disagree if you think the column should remain for these tables.

[[User:GUtt01|GUtt01]] ([[User talk:GUtt01|talk]]) 19:59, 3 September 2020 (UTC)}}

[[File:Chadwick Boseman by Gage Skidmore July 2017 (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Option A]]
[[File:Chadwick Boseman (28017825484) (cropped 2).jpg|thumb|upright|Option B]]
There have been three discussions and endless edit wars between multiple parties regarding which image to use in the infobox on the [[Chadwick Boseman]] article. The images are included here.

Arguments for option A include being the most recent and best-lit photo. Arguments for option B include that it has no objects in front of the subject.

Since it's evident this issue can't be solved at the article's own talk page, and it primarily relates to creating a biography, I'm opening this RfC to get a wide consensus to stop the edit warring. [[User:Kingsif|Kingsif]] ([[User talk:Kingsif|talk]]) 19:26, 22 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Superstitions in Muslim societies#rfc_31622A0|Talk:Superstitions in Muslim societies]] expired 2020-09-24 03:01 ===
* Id: 31622A0
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

* RFC Text:

Is [[Ibn Warraq]] a reliable source ?
:"Similar to  [[Samuel Marinus Zwemer]]'s reasoning [[Ibn Warraq]] too says that most  of superstitious nuances in Islam are continuation from  pre-Islamic [[Idolatry|idolatrous]] cultural practices including rituals of the Pilgrimage to Mecca and the superstitions associated with  ''jinns in ancient folk tales such as those of Ad and Thamud''.<ref>{{Cite book|last=Warraq|first=Ibn|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=7RQwAQAAQBAJ&newbks=0&printsec=frontcover&dq=Why+I+Am+Not+a+Muslim+Ibn+Warraq&hl=en|title=Why I Am Not a Muslim|date=2010-09-30|publisher=Prometheus Books|isbn=978-1-61592-029-7|language=en}}</ref>"

* RFC Text:

Is [[Swami Vivekananda]] a reliable source ?
:"[[Swami Vivekananda]] reasons that, like many other God-Men preachers who stumble upon untrained state of superconscious and end up in [[Hallucination|phantasmagoria]],  prophet [[Muhammad|Mohammed]]'s inspiration of superconscious state was untrained hence open to [[Hallucination|hallucinations]], that caused things like  Mohammed's visit to heaven with Angel Gabriel on [[Buraq|flying horse]] to mixing up of  array of admirable truths amidst [[Superstition|superstitions]] in [[Quran]]; the combination which leads to contrast of some good actions along considerable [[fanaticism]] affecting humankind for centuries together.<ref>{{Cite book|last=Vivekananda|first=Swami|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=YCI-DwAAQBAJ&newbks=0&hl=en|title=The Complete Works of Swami Vivekananda - Volume 1|publisher=Advaita Ashrama (Publication House of Ramakrishna Math, Belur Math)|year=|isbn=978-81-7505-862-0|location=|pages=[[:s:The Complete Works of Swami Vivekananda/Volume 1/Raja-Yoga/Dhyana And Samadhi|The Complete Works of Swami Vivekananda/Volume 1/Raja-Yoga/Dhyana And Samadhi, Swami Vivekananda; Wikisource link ]]|language=en}}</ref>"


=== [[Talk:The King: Eternal Monarch#rfc_C696F30|Talk:The King: Eternal Monarch]] expired 2020-09-24 03:01 ===
* Id: C696F30
* User: Robert McClenon
* Date: 2020-08-25 02:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|974800624|SOC 974800624}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|980012811|SOC 980012811}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the Reception section be replaced with either of the following sections?

A.  See [[User:CherryPie94/sandbox]].

B.  See [[User:Lizzydarcy2008/sandbox#Reception]].

Please !vote in the Survey section as '''A''' or '''B''' or Unchanged.  Do not reply to other statements in the Survey.  Any replies can go in the Threaded Discussion.  (This will make it easier for the closer to assess consensus.)  The two editors who are having the dispute should make their statements in Statements by Proponents.  Do not reply to those statements.  You may reply to them in the Threaded Discussion.
[[User:Robert McClenon|Robert McClenon]] ([[User talk:Robert McClenon|talk]]) 02:43, 25 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Verifiability#rfc_6D8FD3A|Wikipedia talk:Verifiability]] expired 2020-09-25 10:01 ===
* Id: 6D8FD3A
* User: Michaelbluejay
* Date: 2020-08-26 09:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|975032189|POLICY 975032189}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|980230863|POLICY 980230863}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This policy (WP:V) mentions self-published works but doesn't define that term.  That makes it harder for editors to apply the policy.  The definition on [[WP:USINGSPS]] (''Self-published works are those in which the author and publisher are the same'') is not official, since WP:USINGSPS is a supplement.   Discussions about whether the policy should be defined, and what that definition should be, are [[Wikipedia_talk:Verifiability#Should_this_article_have_a_definition_of_"Self-published"_or_not?|here]], [[Wikipedia_talk:Verifiability#RfC:_Let's_define_self-published_sources|here]], and [[Wikipedia_talk:Verifiability#Yet_another_way_of_thinking_of_SPS|here]].

'''Proposal: add the following definition to WP:V and also replace the definition on WP:USINGSPS with: {{xt|Self-published works are those in which the author(s) of the content have direct control of publication of that content. This may be when they publish directly through their own web site or social media account they control, or when they publish through a third-party publisher (such as Kindle Direct Publishing) or website (such as contributors on Forbes.com) without any editorial oversight.}} 
Please note your agreement or opposition to these changes.'''
-[[User:Michaelbluejay|MichaelBluejay]] ([[User talk:Michaelbluejay|talk]]) 09:11, 26 August 2020 (UTC)}}

Thank you. <span style="font-family:Courier New, Courier, monospace;"><strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;//&nbsp;[[User:TimothyBlue|Timothy]]&nbsp;::&nbsp;</strong>[[User talk:TimothyBlue|<strong>talk</strong>]]&nbsp;</span> 01:24, 28 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Violence#rfc_0B04C63|Talk:Violence]] expired 2020-09-27 04:01 ===
* Id: 0B04C63
* User: Flyer22 Frozen
* Date: 2020-08-28 03:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|975369863|MEDIA 975369863}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|975369865|POL 975369865}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|975369868|SOC 975369868}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|980547761|MEDIA 980547761}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|980547766|POL 980547766}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|980547770|SOC 980547770}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC is based on two questions:

'''1.''' Should the first sentence, whether supported by a dictionary source (as it currently is) or other sources, limit the definition of violence to physical force?

'''2.''' Should the second sentence continue to place the definitions of violence that extend beyond physical force in the context of "less conventional definitions"...even while unsourced?

For those viewing this RfC from an RfC listing, see [[Talk:Violence#Defining violence in the lead sentence|above]] for more commentary on the matter. [[User:Flyer22 Frozen|Flyer22 Frozen]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Frozen|talk]]) 03:18, 28 August 2020 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following italicized sentence be included in the [[MOS:LEAD]] after the first amendment reference? If you would support its inclusion, but request a different source please include something akin to ''*'''Support''', but with a more objective source.'' If you would support its inclusion, but not in the lede please include something akin to ''*'''Oppose''', but only in the lede.''

''In [[Holder v. Humanitarian Law Project]] in which the [[Supreme Court of the United States]] upheld a law that allowed the federal government to prohibit citizens from providing material support to foreign terrorist organizations, the court stated ‚ÄúWe ... do not suggest that Congress could extend the same prohibition on material support at issue here to domestic organizations‚Äù which has been understood as a hint of the courts rejection of applying terrorist status to domestic organization.<ref>{{cite web|last=FELDMAN|first=NOAH|date=June 1, 2020|url=https://www.chicagotribune.com/opinion/commentary/ct-opinion-trump-antifa-free-speech-noah-feldman-20200601-il5dljk3rnddxfxj7yd6vonkg4-story.html|title=Trump‚Äôs threat to label antifa a ‚Äòterrorist organization‚Äô is a threat to free speech|publisher=Chicago Tribune|accessdate=September 27, 2020}}</ref>'' [[User:GreenFrogsGoRibbit|GreenFrogsGoRibbit]] ([[User talk:GreenFrogsGoRibbit|talk]]) 20:54, 27 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_CCA4B68|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2020-09-28 17:01 ===
* Id: CCA4B68
* User: Bookku
* Date: 2020-09-27 14:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There seems to be some good discussion taken place at [[Wikipedia:Village_pump_(policy)#Is it time to place greater restrictions on AfD?]] for past some weeks. 

Herewith I am requesting comment for; two minimum quarterly thresholds criteria  for participating in further deletions.

:Criteria 1) There should be minimum: Null / One / Five / Ten / Twenty percent quarterly unreverted  positive encyclopedic text contribution  of total deleted or reverted contribution before joining in further deletions and reverts.
:Criteria 2) There should be minimum : Null / Thousand / Five thousand / Ten thousand / Twenty thousand bytes quarterly positive encyclopedic contribution before joining in any deletion / move /merge / AfD discussion.

Choose your preferred criteria.Or Suggest some new. 

Thanks 

* End of RfC proposal note.

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Articles for deletion#rfc_84CA8A6|Wikipedia talk:Articles for deletion]] expired 2020-09-30 01:01 ===
* Id: 84CA8A6
* User: TimothyBlue
* Date: 2020-08-31 01:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|975903661|POLICY 975903661}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|981056641|POLICY 981056641}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Background: I believe there may be a problem regarding the clarity of the guidelines establishing notability for shopping malls/centers. The two applicable guidelines are WP:GNG and WP:NBUILD. Routine, average coverage that any and every mall will have such as announcements about openings, closings, and events and articles, local promotional articles and articles about land redevelopment after a mall closes are being interpreted as WP:SIGCOV to establish notability. I base this on a number of current and recent AfDs.¬∑

Question: Should existing guidelines be clarified (or a new guideline created) to provide more guidance between what is considered routine ''run of the mill'' coverage and what coverage will establish notability? <span style="font-family:Courier New, Courier, monospace;"><strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;//&nbsp;[[User:TimothyBlue|Timothy]]&nbsp;::&nbsp;</strong>[[User talk:TimothyBlue|<strong>talk</strong>]]&nbsp;</span> 01:01, 31 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2020 United States racial reckoning#rfc_E477B2B|Talk:2020 United States racial reckoning]] expired 2020-09-30 11:01 ===
* Id: E477B2B
* User: Kilopylae
* Date: 2020-08-31 10:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|979963659|POL 979963659}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|979963663|SOC 979963663}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|981114870|POL 981114870}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|981114875|SOC 981114875}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This article should be merged into [[2020 United States racial unrest]] (see also discussions there about changing that article's name). The intention of that article is to provide a broad, overarching summary of the wave of opposition to system racism and support for Black Lives Matter in 2020; this article seems to have a similar focus. I don't think the distance between "''injustice reckoning''", referring more to public awareness and changes, as far as I can tell, and ''unrest'', implying more of a focus on the protests and riots, is sufficient to justify not having one main overarching article that brings everything together. ‚Äî[[User:Kilopylae|Kilopylae]] ([[User talk:Kilopylae|talk]]) 10:12, 31 August 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Tommy Robinson (activist)#rfc_1956FFA|Talk:Tommy Robinson (activist)]] expired 2020-10-01 14:01 ===
* Id: 1956FFA
* Date: 2020-09-16 11:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the info box contain a list of Robinsons criminal history. Multiple discussions have been had regarding this, [[Talk:Tommy_Robinson_(activist)/Archive_3#Infobox_Criminal|here]], and multiple revisions have been attempted and reverted [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=883298394&oldid=prev here], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tommy_Robinson_(activist)&diff=prev&oldid=971155226 here] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=883299960&oldid=prev here] 

Against users argue that highlighting a long list of convictions is contrary to the info box's purpose of being a summery and is [[WP:TENDENTIOUS]], and [[WP:UNDUE]] and highlight that other notable figures with criminal history do not have their convictions listed and that he is more notable for his Activism than his Criminal activities.

For users argue that a significant amount of the coverage in [[WP:INDEPENDENT]] [[WP:RS]] relates to Robinson's criminal convictions so it is notable enough to feature in the infobox, and his criminal history could even warrant it's own article [[WP:GNG]]. 11:21, 16 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Who We Are and How We Got Here#rfc_C26E932|Talk:Who We Are and How We Got Here]] expired 2020-10-01 23:01 ===
* Id: C26E932
* User: Truth Is King 24
* Date: 2020-09-01 22:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|976241195|SCI 976241195}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|981376453|SCI 981376453}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following summary of Chapter 11, which has been contributed but has been repeatedly reverted, be permitted to be published, without further reversions: favor.

If you feel it should continue to be blocked: oppose. 

Chapter 11 is entitled, "Fear of Race and Identity." At the beginning of this chapter Reich describes the hostile reception received by his work on prostate cancer, which showed that the higher rate of prostate cancer previously observed in African American men is largely genetic in origin. In a section of this chapter, entitled "Real Biological Difference" Reich further notes, "an orthodoxy that the biological differences among human populations are so modest that they should be in practice ignored ... ." He then states that the genome revolution is producing results that are "making it impossible to maintain the orthodoxy ... as they are revealing hard evidence of substantial differences across populations." He also observes that "traits shaped by many mutations (as is probably the case for behavior and cognition)" are "targets" of natural selection, just as are traits that are determined by fewer genetic differences, like skin color.{{sfn|Reich|2018}}

[[User:Truth Is King 24|Truth Is King 24]] ([[User talk:Truth Is King 24|talk]]) 22:58, 1 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Muhammad Iqbal#rfc_8E7B67A|Talk:Muhammad Iqbal]] expired 2020-10-04 12:01 ===
* Id: 8E7B67A
* User: ÿ¥ÿßŸá ÿπÿ®ÿßÿ≥
* Date: 2020-09-04 11:47:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|981783974|HIST 981783974}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|981783985|POL 981783985}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is a discussion going on regarding whether or not [[Muhammad Iqbal]] should be labeled an "Indian" in the lead section. 2 Editors have already displayed agreement that it should, however [[User:Idell]], who is a Pakistani national with a manifest and obvious bias towards this topic, disagrees and thinks he wasn‚Äôt an Indian, and should rather be identified otherwise. The insistence on his identification as a "British Indian" makes little sense, as the specific type of state that existed at the time makes little difference to the national identity as "Indian", an identity which has existed for millennia. Furthermore, there is specific and explicit self-identification by the individual in question himself, which utilises "Indian", nothing more or less: 
‚Äú'''Rumi is Sir Muhammad Iqbal‚Äôs great master ... he names himself as Mureed-i-Hindi (the Indian disciple)"''' {{cite web |last= Said |first= Farida |title= REVIEWS: The Rumi craze |url= http://www.dawn.com/weekly/books/archive/050508/books18.htm |accessdate= 2007-05-19 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20070927220804/http://www.dawn.com/weekly/books/archive/050508/books18.htm |archive-date= 2007-09-27}}. 
It is evident that bias caused by nationalism is causing the display of post hoc fallacies on a public encyclopedia which is supposed to embody freedom of information and bias-free impartiality. [[User:ÿ¥ÿßŸá ÿπÿ®ÿßÿ≥|ÿ¥ÿßŸá ÿπÿ®ÿßÿ≥]] ([[User talk:ÿ¥ÿßŸá ÿπÿ®ÿßÿ≥|talk]]) 11:47, 4 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Superstitions in Muslim societies#rfc_E613B4E|Talk:Superstitions in Muslim societies]] expired 2020-10-06 05:01 ===
* Id: E613B4E
* User: Bookku
* Date: 2020-09-06 04:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|976971925|RELI 976971925}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|976971928|SOC 976971928}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|976993988|SCI 976993988}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|982099820|SCI 982099820}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|982099825|RELI 982099825}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|982099828|SOC 982099828}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
While some questions are raised at [[Talk:Superstitions in Muslim societies]] about article [[Superstitions in Muslim societies]]  IMHO wider attention, consultation and  consensus is preferable that is why created RfC [[Talk:Superstition#RfC Superstitions in Muslim societies related questions]] that sounds logical to me, but some seem to expect Rfc at this page. So I am retaining that Rfc there and adding separate RfC to this talk page too.    


I could see following points need to be brainstormed.

1) Is word 'superstition'  positive one?, whether  'folk belief' or something similar would be appropriate instead ?

2) Whether same  definition as of main [[Superstition]] article should apply to rest of superstition article or it should be different ?

3) How and what kind of exemptions should be allowed to religious, folk and cultural beliefs to avoid them being covered in superstition related articles. 

4.1) Superstition related article titles  should be Communities oriented, religion oriented 

4.2) for example Superstitions in Muslim societies covers few non-religious superstition among Bangladeshi pregnant women ? Should such coverage be allowed ? Is it leading to [[WP:Coatrack]] issues.

4.3) Alternate name suggestions for Superstitions in Muslim societies are or [[Superstition in the Islamic world]], [[Islamic views of superstition]] Whether such change will be able to accommodate such superstitions not having religious standing but exists in communities as example given above?

4.4) Or another suggestion has come to consider title  [[Superstition in the Muslim world]]?

4.5) When Criticism of Religion related articles do exist whether separate superstition related articles focusing communities or religion are needed at all? 

My personal opinions are obviously different, but I have attempted to be as neutral as possible,  What are your opinions ? Let us brainstorm.
[[User:Bookku|Bookku]] ([[User talk:Bookku|talk]]) 04:52, 6 September 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[User talk:Crouch, Swale/England#rfc_78CCA5C|User talk:Crouch, Swale/England]] expired 2020-10-06 12:01 ===
* Id: 78CCA5C
* User: Crouch, Swale/England#rfc_78CCA5C
* Date: 2020-10-05 17:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|982012439|HIST 982012439}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|982142806|HIST 982142806}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There has been some discussion about how to create/maintain articles on [[civil parishes]] in England. There has been discussion on having a bot create the articles but this hasn't yet been done due to not having the code or consensus (generating a code for this is needed so if anyone can that would be appreciated). Although this RFC is mainly aimed at page creation it does also talk about how the data can be added/maintained to existing articles. Previous discussions at [[Wikipedia:Bot requests#Civil parish bot]], [[Wikipedia:Bot requests/Archive 79#Civil parish bot]] and [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)/Archive 160#Civil parish bot]]. The 1st, 2nd and 3 (which will probably simply be "no") questions relate to civil parishes, namely their creation/maintenance and if they should be split or merged. The 4th and 5th aren't that relevant here but are related to how to handle other places and their notability so answering these questions isn't so important but please feel free to try to answer then to. Note that I have removed NOMIS due to that fact that its boundaries shown seem to be inaccurate but if you look at [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User:Crouch,_Swale/England&diff=981523679&oldid=945551994#Civil_parishes this] version you can see the boundaries since it the maps are better than City Population De's. Please answer each question in its section and make other comments in the "Discussion" section. My !votes are already on the user page but yours should go here. {{Ping|PamD|Acabashi|Amakuru|SilkTork|Redrose64|Spike 'em|Headbomb|DannyS712|Keith D|Rodw}} who have made significant contributions, please feel free to ping anyone else. '''[[User:Crouch, Swale|<span style="color:Green">Crouch, Swale</span>]]''' ([[User talk:Crouch, Swale|<span style="color:Blue">talk</span>]])  17:32, 5 October 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Internet#rfc_4A0AD53|Talk:Internet]] expired 2020-10-06 18:01 ===
* Id: 4A0AD53
* User: Popcornfud
* Date: 2020-09-06 17:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
